Reviews.Title: “very convenient for airport travel”
Reviews.Author: jointfixer
Reviews.Content: My family and I usually stay here before and sometimes after a flight. It has breakfast, parking and a shuttle to the airport. They have a small gym and pool. The room are adequate and clean. They have a refrigerator and a microwave. Their is a restaurant on site and many restaurants close by that deliver.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced utility hotel”
Reviews.Author: Costin S
Reviews.Content: It's an adventure to reach the hotel and their website indications aren't that precious or simple. For the ones that still may want to reach it, just get the Hertz Logan airport POI and you'll be able to see it when in the neighborhood. First surprise came from the front-desk when I was candidly asked if I'm sure I have a reservation there ... only seconds later to get the confirmation while I was already checking out checkmytrip.com in order to get the nice but customer relations unskilled lady the confirmation of the booking. Second surprise - suites. Now, I just got back from an inferior ranked location in which one room was bigger than the entire "suite" from this hotel. I believe that 3 closet sized rooms (bathroom included) cannot be considered a suite even if you throw a second tv in the living and a large desk with three chairs (?!!??!?). AC was noisy and I mean very noisy. Not to be picky but even turned off the device was making sloshing noises. May worth mentioning that the in-wall unit is 3 feet away from the bed so no-one can be mislead by my not at all bat like hearing abilities. Internet connection costs $ 9.99 per day PER DEVICE... and the speed is analog lines dial-up... cross-referencing Logan Airport's $7.99 24 hours premium access and also their lower speed advertising based free WiFi option (which by all means it's nothing but a fast one to which you are granted access upon viewing an ad or completing a survey) I can conclude that this is a rip off. Shorting this review out although there are other things to be said, the shuttle van that transports you to the airport may leave you in the wrong terminal if you were unfortunate enough to respond to the driver question about the airline you're traveling with since he's unaware of the term of code-sharing and every attempt to tell him that you should be dropped off at terminal B instead of E it's futile. For what it matters, walking the almost 2 miles inside the airport from terminal E to B it's a good workout and you also have go walk in an open parking lot so be sure to have a shower before you check out from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and quiet”
Reviews.Author: briak-ky
Reviews.Content: Nothing special about this hotel except its location. It is directly across The street from Hertz rental car return. This allows ease of returning the car the night before departure and taking the hotel shuttle bus in the morning to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Zulyd
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night with my family. We came to Boston from NY to bring my daughter to a concert to the Agganis Arena at Boston University. We were looking for a pleasant stay to enjoy with the family after the concert. We found it here, and it couldn't have been better. Excellent customer service from the front desk (Carla and Jonathan are awesome) to the parking attendants. Excellent service and great welcome to Boston - Thanks for a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Logan, Great Staff, Good Food but a little older”
Reviews.Author: P4620
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night because I had a 6AM flight. Staff was great to deal with, very helpful and friendly. Dinner at the onsite restaurant was better than expected and was reasonable for a hotel. I would have given it a 4.5 or 5 if the rooms were newer. The hotel is 2 blocks away from AVIS return area so very easy to return car the night before and jump on the hotel shuttle in the AM. It was about a 5 minute drive in the shuttle to the airport. The shuttles seemed to be going all the time. No need to book a time, if one is full the other will be back in a few minutes. There wasn't much in the way of food near the hotel but the hotel had a restaurant with a fairly substantial variety of food and price points, a snack bar area with small sandwhiches plus the Free evening apps/drinks plus the free breakfast which starts at 5:30AM Standard 2 room embassy suite with a TV in each room plus a small fridge and Microwave, sink and workdesk. Heat worked well without drying you out and the shower was great. I am a fan and will stay here again under similar circumstances. It was a fair bit cheaper than the other hotels right near Logan.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but the service is bad all around”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravelfamily4
Reviews.Content: We spent one nights. Had a bad experience in the restaurant, because the forgot to put in our order. Couldn't get help with bags to or from the room. All around it was a bad experience. Simply lazy people working there. I stay at Hiltons all the time and this one should be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Stay and Park at Logan”
Reviews.Author: jsfisch
Reviews.Content: My family was flying out of Logan for vacation and rather than driving the 1 1/2 hours to the airport we decided to stay overnight and park for the week. We've stayed at Embassy Suites before and have found each of them to be very well-equipped -- pools, free breakfast, courtesy shuttle to airport, and helpful staff. This one proved to be the same. Two enthusiastic thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location!”
Reviews.Author: CrisInMI
Reviews.Content: Staying with family--2 boys ages 10 & 13. They loved the breakfast and pool. Hotel is 5 minute walk to the "T" which takes you anywhere you want to go. Great room on 9th floor with awesome city skyline view. This was our first trip to Bah-ston, but definitely not our last!!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: mrsduffel
Reviews.Content: We flew into Logan on Friday 10th and stayed for our first night at the Embassy Suites Logan Airport. We picked this hotel as it was close to the airport, offerered a free courtesy bus service and included a cooked breakfast. We were greeted by a very friendly lady on reception and our room was ready for us, a 2 queen suite. The room was clean and tidy and the bed was comfy, the only downside was the pillows....they felt like they were filled with chopped foam rubber! We decided to go for a walk and the lady on reception gave us a map of how to get to a small mall with a supermarket and slso marked was a pizzeria which we went to and had a fab takeaway pizza for $11.50, great value as it fed all 3 of us! There was a managers reception available but we didn't go down to it as we were tired and by this time full of pizza! Breakfast the next morning was excellent, a great choice and all fresh. We were only staying one night but left feeling we would definately choose Embassy Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the airport and 5 minutes walk from the T”
Reviews.Author: Brunei110
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior to a morning flight. We checked in quickly and found the staff friendly and helpful. They looked after the car while we took our many bags to the room so I could then return it to the rental office; this meant I did not have to park it. The suite was nice and fine for two adult couples. We were surprised to find a managers welcome appetizers was served free in the evening and a buffet breakfast was also included. We walked to the T station which was just across a soccer field; Quincy Market was only 3 stops away. Overall, a great experience and a hotel that I would recommend and stay at again. Also a big thank you to the shuttle driver as he was especially helpful, unlike the one from Thrifty Rental Cars.

Reviews.Title: “Great room & breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Sabrinabean
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on rooms here so we stayed after a late flight into Boston. Really nice hotel, clean and comfy. Spacious rooms and seriously excellent breakfast. Only downside is parking, there is none so you pay the valet $35

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Scott B
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with top notch sevice. I liked the breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied our requirements and a bit more”
Reviews.Author: paw_kirkham
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights prior to flying out on 31 December 2011. Checkin somewhat slow with obly one person on checkin at time. Small drivewat had to unlad quickly before off loading rental next door at Hertz. managers snacks on offer at the time of our arrival. Small Health Centre did the job, breakfast good, cook to order omelette on offer. Room good size for 5, two doubles and a pull out. Promotional free wi fi with Hilton Loyalty on offer was helpful. Courtesy bus no problem to airport. Hotel 5 minutes walk to subway to Boston. Could not find an eatery in close walking distance. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, T is a two Minute Walk”
Reviews.Author: MJCNewYork_NewYork
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, ask for a higher floor room when making your reservation. The staff was great, the location was great. The airport T station is only a couple of minutes from the hotel. I would recommend this place to anyone. There is a nice park across the street also, it is on the way to the T.

Reviews.Title: “If you have an early flight”
Reviews.Author: Kawhona
Reviews.Content: Yes the hotel has some wear and tear but it is reasonably priced, at the airport (walk across the parking lot to return you car at Avis or dollar) , a nice staff and reasonably fast wireless. If you have an early morning flight this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: FortWorth1984
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel previously, but we were still impressed with the staff. They were kind and helpful! The breakfast buffet was awesome, great selection. We also enjoyed the snacks in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: LittleMel104
Reviews.Content: We wanted something convenient and affordable, but we did not expect the level of comfort we got! Free internet, lots of channels, the subway within walking distance, a NICE free breakfast with lots of options, and a quick and easy shuttle right to our terminal for our flight early in the morning. And to boot, the bed was like Baby Bear's: not too hard and not too soft. We had a very relaxing good night's sleep and woke up well-rested. Very clean, well-kept, and the staff was very helpful. We will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Good for pre-or post- flight stay”
Reviews.Author: Zoyenka
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night before flying to Europe. Nice room (actually two rooms), quiet, and nice bath products and har dryer. Free Wifi. The only negative might their food - breakfast was adequate but unremarkable. Enjoyed the short walk to the "T" to go downtown to sightsee. Convenient shuttle back to the airport for the price of a tip. For my needs, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “could be great, but!”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: I found the Hotel nice, two room suits micro and frig. Free Breakfest was a plus, not busy at all. Maybe because it was the first weekend of Dec. Suttle service was also good. It was just 5 minn. walk to Subway. You do not have to cross soccar field as there is a lighted side walk around edge of soccar field. Was not worried to walk by myself at all. The only downside was the Resturent. It was a little to expenive. Since it was near airport you do not have much choise. No resturents near by. My wife injured her foot on trip to Boston so she had to stay in her room the three days. So I gave it 4 stars, If the prices of the Resturent was a little cheeper I would have given it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value with Parking Package”
Reviews.Author: vpellerin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with a park, sleep and fly package on Dec. 6th. The room was nice, clean and roomy. The bed was comfy. With the Hilton Honors program we got free internet and two bottles of water in the room which was a nice perk. The only issue we had was that we didn't read the writing near the heat/ac unit that said to put the fan on so that it didn't turn off and on, so we were woken by it repeatedly, but again it was our fault for not reading the writing until the next morning. The fitness center is nice and clean with some treadmills and an elliptical. It would have been nice to have an actual weight machine since there were only dumbbells, but you can still get a decent workout. The evening snacks were good and the restaurant was fine, but it had a limited selection. The breakfast was also good, with a selection of hot and cold items. We had not problem with the shuttle and didn't have to wait for more than a few minutes in either direction.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep and stay before Aruba”
Reviews.Author: AGMcTravelers
Reviews.Content: We would just like to thank the staff at Embassy Suites Boston-Logan for their quality service and concern for their patrons. Though we were there for only one night, the rate was very reasonable for the convenience in getting an early and easy ride to the airport. When we returned to Boston-Logan Airport from Aruba and retrieved our luggage, we called the hotel. We hopped on the next Embassy-Suites Shuttle which picked took us to the hotel within five minutes where our car was waiting for us. The servers at the Porter Bar and Grill were excellent as was the food. The rooms, suites rather, are very clean and spacious. We researched stay-and-fly packages at Stay123.com ParkSleepFly.com and directly with the Embassy Suites. We urge future travelers to read all the reviews and responses to the reviews. PLEASE NOTE that the ultimate reason for choosing this hotel was because we appreciate that the general manager, Michael Frotten, takes the time to read the reviews posted here, AND you know this because he responds to them. This meant something to us. If you have any questions at all about the hotel or amenities, just call or email the hotel for more information. Mr. Frottenâ€™s email address can be found in other reviews. Also, we did not take note of the greeterâ€™s name at the main entrance to the hotel, but he there for our arrival and departure. He was very professional and friendly and provided us with very good directions for getting out of the airport area and back on to I-95 north to Maine. He remembered us from our first brief meeting which as eight days prior. This is a must stay for anyone traveling from New England to Aruba, which was also amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: tjg986
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights pre-cruise. The location is perfect. Van picked us up at airport within 10 minutes of calling, even though it was close to midnight. The room was clean and comfortable. We did have a water leak from the bathroom ceiling, but a quick call to maintenance fixed that. We did have to request an extra blanket and it took 2 calls but no big deal. The breakfast was very good and a nice way to start the day. The T station is a 5 minute walk and we never felt uneasy or unsafe walking it at night. I got this deal thru USAA travel and it was a great deal for this city. I see that most hotels in Boston are pretty pricey. Thank you for a nice trip.

Reviews.Title: “Did not expect to like it so much!”
Reviews.Author: KiowaVT
Reviews.Content: Great location. Land at airport, check in, shower, leave bags, walk through a park to subway (Boston T Blue Line) and car rental is 100 feet away as well. Everything worked well for me. Nice breakfast. Nice fitness room. Service I had was great. I expected it to be less friendly or convenient, but I will be back. Rates were the original temptation.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to airport and subway”
Reviews.Author: YTLiu-TW
Reviews.Content: Free 24h shuttle bus to airport. It's easy access to subway "airport station". The room is big and clean. We got free wifi service during thanksgiving. Excellent breakfast! Free appetizer at 5:30 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to airport.”
Reviews.Author: m2347m
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the Labor Day Holiday weekend. The weather was great. We were given the corner suite on the Hilton Honors floor. The rooms were huge. It was probably more of a business room. It had a very large conference table, living room. The subway train is right across the park as everyone says. Even at night, it was okay going through the park. The only thing that wasnt good about the hotel is the pool and jacuzzi. The pool water was cold and the jacuzzi was only warm. There arent very many places to eat around the hotel. We found a place called Ecco about 3-4 blocks from the hotel. The food and drinks were good. We ate there twice for dinner. The menu is sort of fusion....whatever that means for this restaurant because they had a little bit of everything. There's also a pizza place. Didnt try it but smelled really good. Of course, the Embassy serves breakfast every morning which is always a great plus.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Cpl2011
Reviews.Content: Worst management I have ever experienced. Will never return nor would recommend to even my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “ok place”
Reviews.Author: Joanel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our flight. many positive things listed in other reviews. rooms as refrig=small, microwave. etc etc. on the negative side. the heating/cooling system was unbelivably noisy cycling on and off. and the door key opener didn't work several times. had to go downstairs and get the key reset. also there we no luggage carts to bring up your luggage to the room. someone did help us. and said that people take them up and leave them. Soooo why doens't someone from the hotet go up and get them?

Reviews.Title: “Great for an overnight near the airport.”
Reviews.Author: Bbilderback
Reviews.Content: Great for an evening arrival from the West Coast. Wish I would have booked the rental car a day later to save the $32 parking fee as the hotel has a free van to/from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing for the price!!!”
Reviews.Author: HotelGuy419
Reviews.Content: Amazing price and great location! 5 minute walk to the "T" (Boston Subway) I loved my stay at this hotel! It had a great breakfast buffet in the morning and reception at evening was good as well. Personally I do not understand anyone giving this place a negative review. Only down side I noticed was the view from a basic king suite was poor. It was just a bunch of construction. However, I would stay here again ANYTIME!! If I could give in more stars I would. Janette at the front desk was a great help to.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: SJohan01
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay near the airport the night before our flight after dropping off our rental car. It was so convenient as Avis, and most of the other hire companies were walking distance of the hotel and there is a free shuttle to the airport. The rooms were a good size, even had a microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Great cost/quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: Toulouse_Yankee
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in other Embassy Suites and found them to be consistent in quality. Other reviewers have mentioned comfort and cleanliness, ample space, nice amenities, fantastic breakfast buffet included in room price. The staff are generally cordial and attentive. Shuttle service to several airport points in addition to the terminals (car rental, subway stop to city center, etc.) is another plus. Free internet at business center in lobby, but..... The drawbacks are cost of parking ($35 per night) and pay-for-internet in the room. The restaurant food is nothing to write home about, as others have mentioned. Still, a great bargain and a nice place to stay when traveling through Logan Airport.

Reviews.Title: “All that you could need in an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: tropicaltraveller9
Reviews.Content: Clean functional suite - a nice touch to have a separate living room/kitchen included for a very reasonable rate. Good buffet breakfast & easy fast shuttle to the airport. Restaurant food a little ordinary but table service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would stay again-value & location a plus”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraLeary
Reviews.Content: I usually don't like airport hotels but this one is well kept even if not the top of the line. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the services very nice. We drove into Logan airport to drop off our rental car, were picked up expediently by the hotel bus even though we were several hours early for check in. Our luggage was stored and we took the Blue line into downtown Boston which is very conveniently located about 3 blocks from the hotel. Upon return, our room was ready and we were happy to have the larger space, living room, kitchenette and bedroom; our room was quiet, unlike many other airport hotels. The managers happy hour included light snacks and beverages which were all we needed after a big lunch in the city. A full made to order breakfast was available in the morning, included in the price. The van back to the airport was timely. I would stay there again, the price can't be beaten by hotels in the historic district and the proximity to the blue line negates any inconvenience of being on the other side of the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: festive_9
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel just because it was near the airport and we had an early morning flight to catch. A great find, The shuttle took a bit of time picking us up form Logan but the subway is only 2 -3 minute walk away. We were leaving very early and the buffet breakfast was available I think from 5.30am choice of hot/cold food. Staff were welcoming and helpful room was spacious bed very comfortable tv in both sitting room and bedroom. We'd booked a hotel in central Boston but this was much better, bigger and comfortable and cost less. The views from both hotels not great so for a short city trip (day or two) I'd stay here and use the great transport directly into the centre of Boston and hotel at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to get to.”
Reviews.Author: LiamWillTravel
Reviews.Content: I was trying to get to the hotel using my GPS but it kept taking me to the block-off side of Porter Street. I parked on the ghetto streets and asked the valet how to get to the open side of the hotel and he told me this happen all the time and advised me to get back to the freeway and follow the rental cars signs. The hotel is all the way at the end of the rental cars street. Since i was not familar with the area and it was night, it took me almost another hour to find my way to the hotel. No self-parking. Cost me $32 for valet. I'll know next time. Won't be my first choice, may 3rd or 4th for next hotel stay near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and roomy”
Reviews.Author: PipeCleaner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a business seminar. The hotel was picked out by our corporate office of Rooter-Man in N. Billerica, MA. This hotel is very convenient (a short 4 min walk) to the (T), the public transportation system in Boston. The staff was very accommodating to the guests. The breakfast each morning was outstanding. The pool and hot tub were both, very nice and relaxing after a long day. When I return to Boston I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Why No PBS?”
Reviews.Author: TravelingPseudonym
Reviews.Content: Yes, the other reviews are right: the rooms are big, clean, and well-appointed. The hotel is convenient for the airport. The complimentary breakfast is hot and features eggs, bacon, and sausage (however, there were only the ubiquitous scrambled eggs and cubes of melon and pineapple, and I could do without the big noisy flat screen TVs in the breakfast area -- which no one was watching). But my real frustration was the lack of PBS on the cable system. There were two big screens in my suite, and nothing but dreck to watch. And the hotel staff didn't seem to have ever heard of PBS! How can this be in the land of Boston's famous WGBH PBS station? For me, this is like going to a restaurant that can't serve you a glass of water. It's a deal breaker. Go here if you like to watch commercials and people screaming at each other.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for airport; close to center”
Reviews.Author: x229
Reviews.Content: Fairly standard Embassy Suites, although the rooms were a little smaller than normal. Better than expected: The shuttle service, which served the local train station "on demand". Worse than expected: "Manager's reception" did not include any beer, wine or spirits. (local state law). If you get a good rate, then this is a worthwhile hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An affordable, quality property”
Reviews.Author: TheFlyingMommy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located along the same street as the rental car companies. And, is within walking distance of a park. The shuttle runs about every 15 minutes from the hotel to airport. Upon arrives at Logan, you can call the hotel - the shuttle arives to pick you up with 20 minutes. The rooms are comfortable, clean, and well-appointed. There's a microwave, small fridge, living area, and sink. The desk and desk chair was very comfortable to work at. And, I was pleased with the sheets. They were soft; so often, hotel sheets are very stiff. The hotel offers complimentary breakfast, and lunch for meetings. The food is tasty, everything is clean, and the servers attentive. I stayed at the Embassy Suites because I had a meeting there. The room worked well - though it was right off the dining area, we couldn't hear any distracting noise while in the meeting room.

Reviews.Title: “location and price”
Reviews.Author: poptrvlr
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel in the Boston area. The hotel itself if close to the airport with free shuttle service too and from. We visited Boston for a few days and found this hotel one of the best places we have stayed in. For Boston the price is good. The rooms were large and very clean. Great staff-very helpful and also free shuttle service to the front door of the T line. (its a short walk but they will take you there!) Great breakfast and helpful service! I cannot say anything bad about the Embassy. If I ever find myself in Boston again I will be sure to book with them.

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PtownTMW
Reviews.Content: We were in town working at the building right next door, so the location was great. It's also across the park from the subway stop called Airport, so it's quite easy to get to and from the airport. The hotel provides a breakfast to all guests in the large atrium in the middle of the hotel each morning, and it's OK. I run a breakfast place with my partner, so I wasn't too impressed with the quality of some of the hot offerings. (How did they heat up the hash browns - boil in bag?!) Another downside for us was the fact that the front desk agent messed up our room key cards. When we arrived at our room, they keys didn't work - for us, or the woman who walked up behind us who was also given that room. Anyway, that was worked out, but not a good first impression. Bottom line is that the hotel is a pretty good value, good location, and it comes with breakfast. Like people say on here though, if you are driving, be patient, as they only have valet, and it's a parking lot down the street so it takes a while. Last point and I don't know why this happened...the price I got on hotels.com was about $100 less per night than the room block my friend secured for the event we were attending...weird.

Reviews.Title: “Best Manager's Reception Yet!”
Reviews.Author: vbmegs
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few times in 2011 for business travel. The hotel has very expensive parking - valet is the only option at $24 daily and the service takes a long time to get your car because there are so many people wanting their vehicles and only 2 attendants. The hotel has no first floor rooms - something I hate since I don't like elevators. The upper floors do take a really long time to get to your room since the hotel is in a square shape up top and I felt like I was walking in circles to get to the right place. The rooms are very nice, smaller than some Embassy Suites but it was to be expected with the location. Very trendy and clean. The restaurant is great, I ate dinner there and loved it. The manager's reception had fresh vegetables, incredible hors d'oeuvres and a cheese and crackers tray that was to die for! The other Embassy Suites I frequent only have chips and salsa and snack mix! There is a free airport shuttle that leaves on the half hour - don't rent a car if you don't need one. It is very close to the highway with immediate access to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Amenity Package”
Reviews.Author: cedartrail
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night at this airport location, but it was enough to leave a positive impression. In the Embassy Suites tradition, the two rooms were large, clean and functional. The breakfast offerings are extensive and the food is good. The best part for us was the fact that the rental car companies are right next door, so returning our Hertz rental was fast and painless. Also, metro access into downtown Boston is only a 7-10 minute walk away. This is a good stop for anyone needing airport access. No negatives to report, however, getting to the breakfast buffet early could save some frustration, especially if you want an omelet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice overall but could use a few improvements”
Reviews.Author: cbrMaine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for a weekend to go to the theater and enjoy Boston. The room was ready when we arrived, which was early, so that was wonderful. Check in was quick and our room was nice and big (we had reserved a king executive suite since there were 6 of us - 4 adults and two kids - staying in the one room and they didn't have any rooms with two double beds available). There was plenty of room to spread out and the king sized bed was very comfortable. Unfortunately, the pullout couch felt like a pullout - nothing luxurious there. The cot we had requested wasn't there when we arrived but I mentioned it to the concierge while asking for directions and she took care of that plus our request for additional coffee and cups for the morning. As others have mentioned, the proximity to the T is about a 5-10 minute walk across a recreation field. We did that during the day but called for the shuttle in the evening and it was very prompt - never more than a 10 minute wait. We did check out the "manager's reception" in the evening on Friday. The appetizers were fairly simple but ample if you wanted a quick snack before a later dinner. Unfortunately, Mass doesn't allow hotels to give complimentary cocktails so only non-alcoholic drinks were available unless you wanted to order one from the bar and they were pricey (the bartender during our stay was rather a grump - I don't recall his name). We ate breakfast in the hotel both mornings and it was fair. You could get cooked-to-order omelets and eggs but everything else was standard buffett fair of sausage, bacon, homefries, scrambled eggs, pancakes and waffles. There was a nice enough selection to keep all 6 of us happy between the items mentioned above plus yogurts, bagels, fresh fruit, oatmeal, pastries and toast. Nothing fancy but enough to keep you full until you can hit Quincy Market! My only complaint was that on Friday evening, after we realized there were no extra pillows in the closet for the pullout couch, our request for additional pillows was never granted. It was remedied the next day. We did also use the pool, which was small but adequate since it wasn't terribly busy. The pool was 3 1/2' deep the entire length, which was nice since I didn't have to worry about my 7-year-old not being able to touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, clean, quiet, breakfast a big plus”
Reviews.Author: RichOrman
Reviews.Content: Assuming you can get a good rate, this is an excellent place from which to base a Boston excursion. The rooms are clean, spacious, and comfortable. Breakfast (included) has omelettes, pancakes, waffles, fresh fruit, bagels, coffee, bacon. Sausage, and oatmeal. Anyone complaining about the breakfast is out of their mind. It is a short five minute walk to the subway, and you can be anywhere you want to be within 30 min

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay While in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Iam14u2c
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location close to Boston Logan Int. Airport appeals to business men and women, as well as members of the airline industry. You will see flight crews from most airlines stay there. The hotel offers complimentary shuttles from and to the airport. The shuttles run about every 10-15 minutes. You will need to phone the hotel from the airport when you arrive at the baggage claim airport to pick you up. For those travelers familliar with the Embassy Suites brand amenities, they offer the cooked-to-order omlettes. The managers' reception DOES NOT offer complimentary alcoholic beverages due to local and state laws. The appetizers, however, tend to be better than at most other Embassy Suites hotels. The beds and furnishings are comfortable. The Airport MTBA T-station (subway) is a short distance away (about a 10 minute walk) and offers convenient trips to the Boston area,

Reviews.Title: “'Cooked to order breakfast' is a bit of a stretch...”
Reviews.Author: txrus
Reviews.Content: Just finished my 2nd stay in this hotel this month. Signs all over, including the shuttles, boast about 'complimentary cooked to order breakfast', but unless you want an omlet, everything else comes from a warming tray pre-made. Let's face it, pancakes & waffles don't do well in warming trays! No idea what they did to the bacon but it was in chunks, not strips. Dinner was also a bit of an adventure, which was surprising considering it was just a burger, but even after taking it back to the restaurant manager, I still ended up w/a very rare, vs. medium rare, burger. Internet on the 1st night of my second trip was literally 'turned off' by an off-site tech & the code I was given for complimentary internet on my first trip didn't work. Beds, however, are quite comfy. If you need a rental car, you have your choice of Dollar, Hertz, & Avis literally at the front door, which is quite convenient. Would likely stay there again, but will likely pass on either breakfast or dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Bobbled Reservation , Super Recovery”
Reviews.Author: YawarMailku
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Boston at 10:30 PM from the west coast to be told that there was no room at the INN. Since we had a reservation number and had paid in advance we were taken aback - After consulting Embassy Suites got us into the Hayatt at LOGAN for the same price plus a complimentary Breakfast. This is the way that Bobbles are supposed to be handled rather than blowing off the customer as a Major Bank would have done. We would consider booking with them in the future.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected”
Reviews.Author: Bill D
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 9am, hoping to store our bags until check-in time, but we were pleasantly surprised to find that our room was ready. This allowed us to check-in, and relax a bit before heading out to see Boston. The complimentary breakfast featured a wide selection, but we thought the dinner menu was a little overpriced. There is a shuttle to the airport, and the hotel arranged transportation to the cruise terminal. There's not much in the way of restaurants close by, but there is a pizza place, Santarrpio's, about three blocks away that is highly recommended, although we didn't go there. The hotel is about a five minute walk from the intercity train station.

Reviews.Title: “Staff makes a good hotel great!”
Reviews.Author: Robert G
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in the hotel during our first stop on a ten day trip during the fall foliage season. Our flight was a red eye from Los Angeles which landed at 6:00am. The Embassy Suites offers a special 24 hour check in rate that allied us to be in our room by 7:30. We were able to enjoy the afternoon and evening in the city. The hotel is located 300 yards away from the T Station. If you are returning from the city after dark, the hotel shuttle will pick you up at the T station for added security. In the evening I needed assistance because of severe leg cramping. The night clerk helped me by going to the kitchen and bringing fresh bananas and juice which alleviated the problem. The concierge helped book sightseeing tours and made restaurant recommendations in the city. The hotel also provided shuttle service to the car rental office upon our departure. The rooms in the hotel provide the high quality of bedding and space that you expect from Embassy Suites, but it was the personal attention and services that made this hotel stand out.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but exorbitant parking fees!”
Reviews.Author: AKArmyWife
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites Logan Airport for three nights. Our room was well-appointed, although we did not get the complimentary snacks that my brother's room came with (he was next door). We had a King Suite and the room was quite comfortable, although a bit on the small side. It didn't really matter, as we generally only use our hotel room to sleep and shower. The complimentary WiFi (Hilton Honors members) was a nice perk, as was the bottled water. The breakfast buffet was fabulous - with so much to choose from, as well as made-to-order omelets. HINT: Get your omelet before adding potatoes and bacon, etc to your plate or they'll be cold by the time you sit down to eat. Breakfast fare included breads, pastries, juice, coffee, bacon, homefries, eggs, fruits, cereal, cheeses, and so much more. There is also the managers welcome each evening - happy hour without the *happy* - as complimentary alcoholic beverages are not offered at this location. The hotel offered finger foods (quesadillas), veggies and dip, and cheeses each evening. The hotel is within walking distance to the T station for transportation to all of the touristy areas. If you don't have to rent a car, DON'T. The hotel charges $34/day to park (valet parking only) We didn't need our car at all while in Boston (but needed it for the remainder of our trip around New England), and incurred almost $100 in parking fees during our stay. Taking the T into town was quick and easy. You save money by loading a Charlie Card up with money (can be done at the same kiosk where you buy your ticket) so if you expect to take several trips into town, this is the best way to go. The kiosk was a bit confusing for us out of towners at first, but there are helpful attendants nearby to walk you through it. The hotel shuttle makes regular loops through the airport, and also offers a shuttle to local attractions (inquire at the front desk). The concierge was fantastic and helped us to plan our trip to Salem, with information regarding the ferry and things to see and do while there. We were quite pleased with the hotel and would choose to stay there again - but without the rental car!

Reviews.Title: “Great Short Break”
Reviews.Author: Migs12
Reviews.Content: What a great short break I had in this hotel in mid September, My 2 daughters and a friend arrived later than expected as plane was delayed, called for courtesy bus, which arrived within 10 mins, great driver assisting us with no bother at all, the guy at reception could not have been more helpful, I asked for a room on a high floor overlooking Boston if possible and he came up trumps with a great room on the 10th floor with a great view. We had booked in to restaurant nearby called Ecco and had missed our time slot due to delay and he called them for us to rebook, everything from then on was just great, breakfast, trolley tour bus from hotel, all staff. This hotel is great value for money considering all the benefits of full breakfast, manager reception,courtesy bus from airport, to T etc. and I will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect before an early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: LP_in_OC
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to New England and spent two restful nights at this hotel: one at the start of our trip, getting in at about 11:15 p.m. after an exhausting day of travel, and one at the end before we flew home. Due to our timing we did not try to do any sightseeing from this location, but for getting to and from the airport, I can't imagine a place more convenient. It is not the most scenic location, perhaps, but it's super quiet and accessible. The room was clean and comfortable, and the front desk staff and shuttle drivers were super friendly and helpful - even late at night. At the end of our trip, after 9 days of staying in small inns and B&Bs, my husband and I really appreciated having things like a couch, a refrigerator, two nice TVs (not that we actually needed two), a decent-sized desk with 3 chairs, good wireless access, and lots of places to plug in electronics to charge. The bar downstairs is convenient for having a quick beer, and includes a good Sam Adams variety on draft that we learned is only available in Boston. The free breakfast is better than any I've had from a chain hotel, and it starts at 6:30 a.m. so we were able to squeeze it in before our flight. The free shuttle got us to and from the airport and the adjacent car rental places in less than 10 minutes. We waited until our first full day of vacation to pick up our rental car to avoid pricey valet charges at the hotel, which worked out perfectly because it took such little time to go straight from the hotel to the car rental lot the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “you can see it but you can't get there”
Reviews.Author: oxfordman
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at several Embassy Suites and this is as nice as any or actually probably the best. However, there is a big caveat to this place. It is simply impossible to try and get there by car. I realize that most people probably don't have a vehicle because it is so close to the airport and that is why we stayed there the last night of our trip to easily use the shuttle to the airport, but arriving we did have a car. GPS maps take you to the corner of the hotel (if you can get there in the first place) which is blocked off to traffic by allegedly city traffic planners. You then drive a maze to try and get to the front of it while trying not to lose sight of the actual high rise. Believe me it was tricky. The hotel itself is very nice and the price extremely reasonable for Boston during a fall weekend. Stay there without a car and walk to the "T."

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spikeboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in September & as usual great hotel & service. They have a shuttle to take you places. We checked on at noon & our plane was scheduled to take off at 7 pm so they locked up our luggage & we could do some more sightseeing. Of coarse there was no charge. Shuttle took us to the airport. Brakfast was good. they could not serve free alcohol because of state rules. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: parobbo
Reviews.Content: The friendly and helpful staff made me give this excellent hotel the worthy five stars. Nothing was too much trouble day or night and they were all so cheerful. The rooms are basic but kept clean and adequate tea/coffee provided each day. There is a comprehensive choice at breakfast and the omlettes are great - cooked to order with a choice of fillings. The bar staff were very cheerful and we found no problem in ordering food late in the evening - which was of a very high standard and reasonably priced. A former review stated that there is only elevator availability to the floors - wrong - the stairs are well signed and we managed them on several occasions to the third floor. There is access to internet in the business centre which was helpful in printing our boarding passes on departure. The T station into Boston is a pleasant five minute walk and the trains are easy to follow and very cheap - $15 for a seven day ticket or $9 for a daily ticket. The drivers of the shuttle buses are very helpful and willing to drop you off at the car hire places/airport or train station with no problem at all. All in all a very well managed hotel - keep up the good service and great welcome to Boston - thanks for a very pleasant stay

Reviews.Title: “Good for two nights”
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights after being in Europe for three weeks. The hotel is convenient to the airport, the room was large and comfortable and the price was right for Boston. They also give a free breakfast. However, if we were to visit Boston for more than two nights we'd definitely stay in the city to be closer to things. Also, this hotel needs a slight facelift as it is showing signs of age.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, could be better”
Reviews.Author: Aquaphine
Reviews.Content: This hotel was okay, but I didn't think it was anything special. The rooms could be a bit more updated in my opinion. They have a great complementary morning breakfast with a lot of choices. They also offered free internet if you sign up for Hilton Honors which was free. They gym was pretty small and there was no way to get upstairs besides the elevator. This made it very inconvenient when large groups of people had checked in and were waiting for elevators. There were only two. Their room service left a bit to be desired as well. They serve until 11pm, but seemed put out when I ordered something at 10pm.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for Boston, convenient to downtown and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DebbyLA
Reviews.Content: Concern a review of construction next door. Had 9th floor room and no noise. Airport and renatl car shuttle. 8 min walk to metro or they will shuttle. Nice B4 dinner snacks and full breakfast. Clean, comfortable and quiet suite. Direct metro to downtown. Easy to get around. Fast ride to North end for dinner or Colonial sites. Very good price for Boston. You can see the river from the hotel. Cruise ships and all but not a view place.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Casey1997
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at this hotel. We were able to check in early without any problems. Their hot breakfast is great with made to order omelets, and many other wonderful items. There is a Manager's reception in the evening with food, we only had to buy lunch while we were out. What a money saver. It is less than a 10 min stroll to a subway station, and there is a free shuttle to Logan Airport. Very convenient to get around Boston, and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Good affordable place.”
Reviews.Author: RaginCajun1
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay when in Boston for a short period. It is on the airport property as well as close to the metro. The airport metro station is a short walk and you then have easy access to all areas. The hotel is one of the better run that we have stayed in. The breakfast is one of the better complimentary that you will fine. The rooms are spacey and well laid out. Would stay here again when we return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Pick a cheap time to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Barlers
Reviews.Content: I had an overnight in Boston on my way home from the west and picked a bad day to do it! Apparently, Friday nights tend to be expensive in Boston hotels - especially when a whole load of cruise ships are departing Boston the following day! I struggled to find a room anywhere near central Boston or the airport and had to settle for a suite at an undiscounted price. Good news - the suite was spacious and comfortable. Bad news - it was way more than I needed, the air conditioning made such a racket that I had to turn it off and sweat instead and I very much resented having to pay over $10 for a day's internet access, having paid so much for the room. Breakfast was pretty poor. A warm buffet with not much choice and the plates/cutlery weren't very clean. The location is quite handy for visits downtown - the T (subway) is a five minute walk - and there is a free airport shuttle. I'm not usually a harsh critic of hotels and, if this had been a reasonably-priced hotel for a 24 hour stay, I would focus on the positives. The hard fact is that, for what I paid, I expected much better.

Reviews.Title: “The best bargain in Boston”
Reviews.Author: kcape
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston for a wedding at Mt. Wachusett and decided to stay a couple of days to see the city. I found this hotel at a bargain price and hoped that it would be as convenient as its website states. We found it more than we bargained for. The hotel is mere minutes from the airport...no rental car or taxi's needed for the whole trip! It fronts a neighborhood park and soccer field which has an T-station at the other side of the park. We walked through the park every morning and every evening and never worried about security. It is well tended and well lit. We used the T to get into the city..very easy to figure out and the station has lots of train employees to help you buy tickets and direct you. Downtown Boston is only two stops away and takes just a few minutes to get to the Freedom Trail. The room was large and as we were traveling with friends, really appreciated the separate bedroom from the living room and small kitchen. The rooms were very clean, well appointed and really nice to come back to at the end of the day. The downstairs bar was perfect for a night cap before bed and the hotel breakfast was really great..everything you could think of. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Boston!

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay when visiting Boston.”
Reviews.Author: MO_outdoor_adventure
Reviews.Content: We were going to be in Boston for an evening, and wanted to check out the tourist spots, etc. We found all the downtown hotels to be way overpriced. So we decided to stay at the Embassy Suites at the airport. It was considerably less expensive. The room was clean and nice. The breakfast the next morning was good. It is only a $2 subway ride to downtown. To get to the station is only a 5 minute walk from the hotel through a park. We came back to the hotel late and felt very safe with this walk (we did encounter a skunk, though).

Reviews.Title: “Location -- Conveinance”
Reviews.Author: FoxTraveler
Reviews.Content: Overview: Stated one night to catch airline home. Stayed here before for a week and a very nice hotel. Location to subway is a 5-minute walk and 24-hour shuttle to airport makes it easy to catch a flight. Will always look to stay here before a flight. Internet is very fast and manager's Evening social has good food to build a meal from -- they cannot serve alchohol complimentary) for some reason so be aware. You can buy it at the bar. Tip: North End for Italian, Union Oyster House for Clam Chowder & Awesome Cornbread and Samual Adams Brewery for a free tour ($2.00 donation), good beer, beer glass and trip to Doyle's for great lunch and free Samuel Adams beer glass w/purchase of beer. Way cheaper than buying glass at brewery and the pictures on the wall at Doyle's are very interesting. Go early as tours fill-up fast.....

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: Lisa8610
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in several Embassy Suites over the years. We have never run out of toliet paper-a first. Also, we had to call 3 times about the air conditioner. You do not have any control over the temperature of your room and my husband and son were too warm.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnSeekers
Reviews.Content: Super family friendly hotel. When we arrived on Sunday morning, we were too early for check in and too late for their breakfast so they brought us out huge platters of pancakes, hashbrowns, sausage and bacon for our group of 9. It was so nice after taking the redeye! The staff was very friendly and always helpful. Housekeeping was prompt and friendly. They always left treats in the room for the kids. I was a little worried about the location but it was perfect. Just a short walk through a park to the T. Be sure to get the 7 day T pass. It was a great deal. The T is easy to understand and a clean and safe way to travel around Boston. I would stay here again! It was by far the kids favorite hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: angienti
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I ever stayed at an airport hotel. I usually like to stay downtown but for the price I had to give it a try. The hotel was great. My sister and I arrived early on a Thursday. It was to early to check in but we checked our luggage and hit the breakfast bar. Everything at breakfast was great all three days of our stay. Although our room overlooked the airport, it was very quiet. It was also very spacious and very clean. Bed was great! The hotel is located across a small park from the train system. We did not have to rent a car, we took the trains everywhere we went. Go ahead and get the 7 day train ticket even if you're only there for a few days. It saved us a lot. We even took a commuter train to Salem for a day trip. It did cost extra but was well worth the price. The couch and chair weren't very comfortable. Internet is free if you're an Honors member, $9 per day if not. All the staff I met were helpful and friendly. This was a sister's trip.

Reviews.Title: “Location + Comfort + Price = Satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: JeffandFaithR
Reviews.Content: We struggled to find affordable accomodation in Boston itself so had to settle for an airport hotel for 2 nights. What a great decisin/stroke of luck! The Embassy is convenient to the airport (but without the noise), accessible to local transport (Shuttle or 10' walk across the park to the T) and cheaper than its counterparts across the river. The suites are large and comfortable (but be prepared to turn off the noisy A/C). Complimentary breakfast has variety and taste. Finally, the staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent saty, odd location”
Reviews.Author: JLS300
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Embassy Suites Boston Logan Airport for 1 evening. Looked for a hotel to end a great vacation in the area and wanted something comvenient to both downtown and the airport, this certainly fit the bill. From check in to drop off at the airport, can not say enough good things about everyone we spoke to. All were smiling and helpful. Rooms are a little small when compared to other Embassy Suites, but they are clean, updated and comfortable. Airport subway stop (2 stops to downtown) is an easy 5 minute walk through the park, or the shuttle will take you/pick you up. Very odd location, they have blocked the street from the area, so the only in/out for traffic is pass rental car lots. Unfortunately (for me!), GPS did not know this, and kept routing me into the area. Finally parked outside the barrier and walked into the hotel to check in. Being so close to the airport, we all commented on our surprise there was no airport/airplane noise at all. All in all, a good stay. PROS *Convenient location *Comfortable room *Full breakfast, was a bit crowded though *Great staff *Great city view from the 9th floor *Big bathroom CONS *Odd access by car *Smaller size rooms *Noisy air conditioner

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Surprisingly Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Cheetah1011
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Flew into Logan Airport for a couple of days in Boston, then a week in Maine, up to Bar Harbor, and back to Boston before flying home. Stayed the first 2 nights in this hotel at a very reasonable price for Boston. Was a bit worried about the location when I booked, but it turned out to be surprisingly convenient. The "T" takes you into Boston and the station is located a short walk through a cute park and across a safely lighted soccer field. The Embassy Suites will gladly shuttle you from the "T" station as well. We rode the shuttle to and from the airport as well as to Enterprise where we rented our car for the week. Liked the hotel so much, we booked a room for our final night. "Welcome back!" was the response when we returned. When we got to the room, we had to call downstairs to make sure we had the room that we were charged for because it was much roomier than the first two nights -- they upgraded us at no charge! Too cool.

Reviews.Title: “Sterile but Convenient”
Reviews.Author: DMilo46
Reviews.Content: Okay, you don't expect Embassy Suites to be particularly charming, but the location at Logan Airport is sterile in the extreme, with plastic couches in the suites and virtually nothing in the way of extras. Still, what you're looking for here is a convenient place to stay and the hotel is five minutes from the airport with a convenient shuttle and, as usual, an excellent breakfast with omelets cooked to order. It's quiet and the beds are convenient, no small thing. We were satisfied but don't come here with unrealistic expectations. It is what it is, no more,no less.

Reviews.Title: “Like Home”
Reviews.Author: BDKChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the weekend that Hurrican Irene hit and ended up extending our stay by 2 days. The hotel and restaurant staff went out of their way to make us feel comfortable especially my 13 year old son. When the airline added a flight Monday and we checked out early afternoon they did not charge us for the final day. We will be back and forth to Boston and will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and fit the bill”
Reviews.Author: sethsdad1
Reviews.Content: Quick trip to Boston - very easy access at Logan Airport as the hotel shuttle is running all the time.Suites were very quiet and functional. Breakfast was similar to other Embassy Suites; only the coffee was not very good. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not my... Tea Party”
Reviews.Author: JackBuffalo
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites Airport Boston is built and functions pretty much as a stopping off point for the air the traveler while in Boston. It's not the spot for the "road tripper" who wants to see Boston. They charge $32 per day to park your car...I consider that a rip off. The hotel restaurant is pricey and the dining choices within walking distance are limited to a somewhat upscale spot called the Ecco and a Pizza joint. The hotel features rather small suites as compared to other Embassy Suites I have visited. The corridors on each floor are long and connecting so if you are unlucky enough to be at the end of the furthest corridor expect a long walk to the elevator. Other reviewers have mentioned the lack of alcohol being served at the managers reception. The serving of alcohol is common at other Embassy Suites. The management says they are prohibitted from giving away alcohol by state law. Here's the solution- charge $1 a drink Seems to be a logical answer...or would that cut into the profits at the bar in the lobby??? The food at the managers reception was un-inspiring, at best . Cheese, veggies and fried hors duevers are offered ...but wouldn't cookies or some other sweet be a welcome addition? All in all....not so great...pretty average.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience !”
Reviews.Author: haztaz69
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights over Labor Day weekend at the Embassy Suites at the beginning of a nine day New England vacation. The location is great. We flew into Logan, caught the shuttle to the hotel. We then used the T to go to Boston. It's only a four minute walk from the hotel. At the end of our stay we picked up our rental car down the street from the Embassy Suites and headed out to see four other states. The customer service was awesome. The employees knew our names. The breakfast was great. The restaurant and bar was good. Room service was good. The room seemed a little smaller then other Embassy Suites we've stayed in. Overall it was a great experience. We got a great deal by paying in advance when we made our reservations. We'd highly recommend the Embassy Suites at Logan Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, great free breakefast, lousy room.”
Reviews.Author: LR9
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty much no-frills, but the lobby in spacious, flean and and the staff is accomodating. The morning breakfast is fairly large, has a number of choices and even includes made-to-order omelettes! The room I had was on the small side, on the 10th floor (which the person checking us in said was where I wanted to be) and it had a nice view of the small park across the street. Unfortunately, I was not in for a good night's sleep. The A/C did not cool well and everytime it started, it sounded like someone was opening the door to enter our room. It was awful. Needless to say I goy very little sleep. One last thing, I do not like being charged $10 per day for internet usage.

Reviews.Title: “Convienent...”
Reviews.Author: sklnurse2
Reviews.Content: We arrived late into Boston Logan (10pm) and had called earlier in the evening to let them know of our late arrival. They instructed us to retrieve our bags, call the front desk, and someone would come to pick us up within 20". That all sounds good until they didn't answer their phone at 10:30pm... After numerous tries, I had someone at an information booth call- it took them 3 times to get through. It did take them 20" to arrive. I was a little surprised to see no one in the lobby and 3 people working the front desk! I guess they just don't like to answer the phone! Our suite was small, but we were only staying one night. It was very quiet for being so close to the airport. The breakfast was amazing- keep going all the way back for the omelet station.... The rental car area is a quick walk down the street- very convienant. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best Embassy”
Reviews.Author: DoDTraveler1
Reviews.Content: The room was old and outdated, very worn, chipped aging furniture. Hilton and Hamptons in the area are much much nicer. Staff was pleasant, breakfast was good, OK Embassy but very very over priced! No GOVT rate available! The rate was $259.00! $105.00 over per diem. If you are military or Govt you can get the per diem rate at the Hilton, Hampton and many others in the area (I learned this too late).

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Joe M
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the friendliness and helpfullness of all staff here at the Embassy Suites, Logan Airport, in Boston. From the parking attendants and front desk, to house keeping and cafeteria people, we felt very much at home during our entire stay. Our room was very clean, comfortable, and equipped with everything we needed. Plus, the location is wonderful, close to public transportaion and easy to get to downtown Boston for all of the historic sights to see!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a budget price”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiFive0
Reviews.Content: Coming from the UK on holiday, I could not believe what a deal I picked up through Expedia for a 2 night stay, prior to going back home. For just over Â£61GBP per night per room, we received 1. 2 bed suite with comfy room, bed and facilities 2. Complimentary unlimited snacks and drinks each night in the lobby 3. Complimentary full buffet breakfast 4. Free internet and printing facilities 5. Complimentary airport shuttle The hotel also had a free pool (bit small) , hot tub and gym, and is a 10 minute walk to the Airport T stop. I am not normally a great fan of airport hotels, but this one fitted the part as great for our early morning flight home to the UK, along with being alot cheaper and still convenient to tour downtown Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient access to downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: BenThereToo
Reviews.Content: This is a nice and convenient hotel. We (4 family members) stayed for 3 nights. We drove to Boston. Be sure to get directions from the hotel because our GPS kept trying to take us directly to the hotel, but Boston has evidently changed the roads. You need to take a circuitous route to get to hotel. On the other hand, the hotel's directions took us right past the airport's economy parking garage (1 Harborside Drive). After unloading our luggage, I went back and parked the car in the parking garage because it was much cheaper than parking at the hotel. We bought week-long passes on the T even though we'd only use them for 4-days. It was still a great deal and the best way to get around in Boston. We had beautiful weather while we were in Boston, and it's a pleasant 5-minute walk thru a park to the T station. The second stop on the T is the Aquarium. So, it is VERY convenient to get to downtown. We traveled all over the place on the T. The hotel is quite nice and far from the airport's fllght paths so we didn't hear any planes from our room. We only got to the manager's reception once. It was quite nice (Note: We don't drink liquor, so that was not an issue for us.), but we didn't miss any breakfasts. They were very good. Don't plan on finding any restaurants near the hotel. We tried it one night, and it was a disaster. You might just as well eat in Boston before going back to the hotel each night. That's why we didn't get to many manager's receptions. As others have suggested, we asked for a room with a view of the harbor. Wow! I'm glad we asked. Both in the daytime and at night it was a beautiful view of downtown Boston across the harbor. We really enjoyed the room, the breakfasts, and the convenience to downtown Boston, and we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “super close to airport, across street from rental cars, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Samueltx
Reviews.Content: Booked a night before we were to leave Boston, but due to Hurricane Irene we booked for an extra night on Saturday. The staff was freindly. Embassy Breakfast buffet was really good. Room very clean, 5 pillows! King bed, suite. One bad thing, chowder was runny. And Well, I like chowder that is thick. I don't expect to watch much TV on vacation, but with the Hurricane we stayed indoors (it never hit Boston though) and watched TV. Not many channels, but like I say, who really needs TV on holiday? Everything was really nice, work out room was nice, towels and water. Hot tub clean. Happy hour was nice. Never ran low on stuff. Scotch is quite pricey, but hey if you want Scotch.... The staff was very alert. They were very helpful to my wife who had an injured foot. Fast shuttle to hotel. Car rental place's are right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Unplanned Oasis”
Reviews.Author: RussDole
Reviews.Content: You can never really plan your vacations months in advance and anticipate that JFK airport (where we had a planned quick layover) would experience a record 8' of rain. On our way to Logan, a text alerted us that our flight was moved from Sunday afternoon to 6am Monday morning. The American Airlines ticket agent informed us of our new itinerary & reserved the room with a "distressed passenger rate". The shuttle picked us up & we were greeted with huge cookies & a manager's reception featuring complimentary soft drinks & appetizers. That went a long way in our transformation from "distressed" travelers to "content adventurers". The room was comfortable & quiet, and the location and shuttle service allowed us as much sleep as possible for a 6am flight. Nice job, Embassy, we have had many great experiences with your brand over the years, and plan on seeing you again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DuaneSandul
Reviews.Content: Most of us think of airport hotels as located, well, away from downtown. Not so in Boston. Yes, it is at the airport, but it is a five minute walk to the metro and only 2 rides from the metro to where things are happening, and a few after that to Boston Common. If you are traveling, the hotel is walking distance to the rental car agencies. In our case, we flew into Boston, stayed 2 nights, then grabbed our rental car for a week trip to Maine. For an airport hotel, the rooms were sufficiently quiet, it had the typical great Embassy Suites breakfast, and free computer use in the business center. You don't need to stay downtown in Boston. This property works just fine.

Reviews.Title: “bad internet service. Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: emilianocalvo
Reviews.Content: very convenient location for the hurried business traveller (close to airport, rental cars, subway, and shuttle-connectet). As expected, you get proper service, rooms, etc, for the price of the room. Except for three week points: - indoor swimming pool is too children oriented, and, high on chloride - internet works very bad (I have noticed this before a couple of times with the same ISP "hhonors" in other hotels) - this is me, but I hate not to have natural orange juice in breakfast buffet (otherwise, great!)

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Citygir
Reviews.Content: Great Boston airport hotel. Will be back. Proâ€™s: - One block from the "T" blue line subway station. Less than 10 min to get into downtown Boston. - Breakfast buffet open at 5:30am - Clean quite rooms - Free water and snack in room (if youâ€™re a Hilton member) Conâ€™s - Not in the tourist area if thatâ€™s important - Onsite restaurant for dinner is not great.

Reviews.Title: “ok, lovely bar staff”
Reviews.Author: munchyDublin
Reviews.Content: reception staff very slow id two rooms booked and waited forever to get into room. rooms ok bit worn but clean, lovely park just outside hotel, bar food excellent and very nice waitress,

Reviews.Title: “Good location, quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyGirlAtHeart
Reviews.Content: We wanted a reasonably priced hotel near the airport for our last two nights of vacation before flying home from Boston and the Embassy fit the bill, meeting many of our preferred options with amenities. My husband was somewhat concerned about airplane noise, but there must be excellent soundproofing because we did not hear one single plane. The room itself was comfortable and spacious enough for four of us. The pull out bed in the sofa was surprisingly comfortable, a pleasant finding. The bathroom had plenty of counter space as well as two doors for separate access to the bedroom and living areas. The evening reception and included breakfast are both nice perks. Decent food, but don't expect anything fancy. The pool is small but good enough for the kids to splash around and have some fun. Being a member of the Hilton Honors club earned us free internet access. The only minor complaint I have would be the elevators. They seemed to run rather slowly although there were three of them. The location is perfect, just a block from some of the car rental returns and a short walk through a park to the T stop. From there it's a short ride into Boston. Although we didn't take advantage of it, we were told that the airport shuttle would also take us to the T station if we so chose. The Embassy Suites was a good choice for us. Close to the airport, easy access to downtown, reasonably priced, family friendly, clean and comfortable. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Blown Away by My Stay”
Reviews.Author: stussyboy1
Reviews.Content: Not only was the hotel nice and close to the airport, but it was conveniently located within walking distance to Boston's area commuter train system, which drop us right off at the wharf. The check-in was quick, the room was very clean and spacious, and the breakfast was killer!! Not only did I receive great service from Elaine(Front Desk Manager) before my arrival, I was also greeted with the same warm friendly service when I arrive at 8:30 at night. I would definitely recommend this property to anyone planning a trip to Boston and looking to save some money, and donâ€™t want to pay the prices that the other hotels were charging within the city. And not to mention, those other high price hotels didnâ€™t include breakfast like the Embassy Suites. To summon it up, â€œI was Blown Away by My Stayâ€�. Thanks for making my trip a great one, and keep up the great work!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice breakfast, disappointed with Manager's Reception”
Reviews.Author: ashnic69
Reviews.Content: We usually only stay at Embassy Suites. We really like them, the rooms are all suites and complimentary hot breakfast and Manager's Reception nightly with free alcoholic drinks. This hotel in particular, the rooms were nice and the staff has been really friendly and helpful. Everyone is nice. The breakfast was good and average for an Embassy Suites. Now about the manager's reception. Usually there is free house alcoholic beverages, due to local laws, none is served (which we understand; it's not their fault). So I assumed the food/appeitizers served would be a little better than

Reviews.Title: “Convenient aiport stay”
Reviews.Author: nautilus01
Reviews.Content: This is a very convenient airport hotel, not a destination hotel by any means, but a perfectly good place if you need to remain close to the airport. The shuttle bus arrived promptly, and it takes under 5 min journey time to get to the hotel. I stayed in a double-roomed suite - very comfortable bed, good large bathroom, separate seating area. The views are typical airport humdrum, but then again, you aren't exactly here for the view. Wireless internet connection is slow and erratic. Short walk across the park to the Airport T stop. Breakfast area looks a bit tired and could do with a revamp, but food quality is acceptable and staff are friendly and helpful. I have stayed here twice in the last 3 years (both business trips), and will definitely be staying here again - A+ for airport convenience!

Reviews.Title: “Super spacious rooms with everything you would need to visit Boston”
Reviews.Author: CBDChick
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a night in July and was immediately impressed by the spacious and welcoming foyer. The staff were friendly and professional though very very busy. The separate living area in the rooms was such a welcome change to small european hotel rooms I had stayed in earlier. There is a small bar fridge, microwave and bar area with coffee machine. The king-bed is incredibly comfortable and a large TV in the bed and living room each. The bathroom was equally spacious with good amenities and Crabtree & Evelyn soaps. Buffet breakfast in the restaurant was incredibly busy but well stocked with an excellent choice of food. The free shuttle bus service to and from the Logan airport and the City center makes this hotel easy access for business and sight-seeing. However there is very little in the immediate vicinity of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: gaving
Reviews.Content: The reason we chose this hotel was because we particularly wanted a suite, the complimentary breakfast was always good, and it was close to the T so we could still tour the city of Boston easily. The room was smaller than we're accustomed, and looked quite dated. The beds were really comfy, though, which is the most important thing I suppose. Breakfast was great even if its the same thing every day. We only caught 1 evening ofthe complimentary Manager's reception and that was decent even if the law prevents them from serving alcohol. The fitness centre was a little disappointing and there was so much chlorine in the air around the indoor pool that it was difficult to breathe. For a traveller, the hotel is all you need. You can use the business centre to check-in online and print boarding passes for free. Now if they could just block facebook, it would allow for more guests to use it for business and travel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, not the best location!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa38Kent_UK
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is lovely, fantastic breakfast with everything you can imagine. The managers reception was the best we have had at an Embassy Suites Hote. The room itself was very spacious, clean and I would definately say this is more plush than other Embassy Suites. Unfortunately, you do have to pay for internet in the rooms and the free internet lounge was often full.The location is great for the airport but not particularly convenient for Downtown Boston, the underground is about a 5-10 minute walk and for adults, the return fare is not especially cheap. With children, you may want a more convenient hotel if you are exploring the city! What I would say is the hotel overall was very good value! For 5 people, we couldn't find anything of a similar price...

Reviews.Title: “excellent location; great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RanaFinn
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to its proximity to Boston Logan airport, and its complimentary shuttle service, to and from it (although, to be honest, there is a very good shuttle service close by, leaving from the Airport metro station). The hotel was everything we needed it to be: nicely furnished, clean, spacious rooms - that included a small fridge, a microwave, two tv's, and a kettle (as we were travelling with our infant son, this was very good to have; and, as we stayed here on two separate occasions, we got to stay in two different rooms); excellent location, with a handy metro (subway) station close by, and the downtown area twenty minutes away (we were pushing a baby stroller); close to the airport, and with friendly staff. The breakfast buffet was not bad, even though it was not too "creative", if you know what I mean.. Just standard stuff: toast, cereals, etc.. For us, however, this did the trick.. Some other reviewers have complained about the Manager's complimentary reception, but we happened to arrive just as it was taking place... It's just a bit of crackers, cheese, etc., with soft drinks.. It helped us fill in a hole in our stomachs, so we could make it downtown for dinner.. We can't complain about it, especially as there was no charge for it.. Of course, we wouldn't go out of our way for it! We also tried the pool, with our child.. It was fine.. The only thing we didn't like is that the floor coming into the pool area can get too wet and slippery; tricky to navigate when you're carrying a child (maybe some draining racks / duck boards would help here).. The staff were very good, and they were lovely to our little boy, who had a blast learning to walk in the spacious lobby (this, by the way, gave us a nice first impression of the place; we hate closed in, stuffy lobbies).. On a down note, the pints of Samuel Adams were expensive, but that's just to be expected in the big cities in the States... The food in the restaurant was fine - nothing too impressive, but did the trick! We would definitely go back, and we certainly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: viskari
Reviews.Content: I'll start with a summary: When on a business trip I look for some essentials in my stay: Good and swift service; A functional room with a good bed; a good restaurant be it for dinner or breakfast. I found the Embassy Suites to cover all these aspects without any doubt and at a budget that is appealing to my company. - - I arrived from Europe to the airport where a quick ring to the hotel (using the courtesy phones in the arrival hall) brought my chariot (or rather: a shuttle bus) to terminal door step. From here it was a 5 minute ride to the hotel where check-in was a breeze.
