The standard suite (2 rooms) had plenty of space and TV in each room, which I guess I'd enjoyed if I'd been more jet-lagged than I was. Aircon was lightly noisy but given that it was > 100degF outside (yes, literally) the A/C wasn't just idling. No noise from the adjacent rooms or from the corridor though. In the morning I went for the included breakfast and found it quite enjoyable, except for the coffee which is always a let-down in hotels in the US. The business center is there but it's not much. It did however come in handy for a couple of print-outs I needed. Getting to the city is a breeze with a blue-line T-stop just 3-4min walk from the hotel taking you straight into the CBD. I had transportation arranged for my business purposes so taxi-costs to the CBD are not known to me but I'm guessing ~$25-30. All and all I really enjoyed my stay and would not hesitate staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Met our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Like-It-Matters
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel as based on the price, it had a separate bedroom, free breakfast and because it was close to the subway line. In these respects, it met our needs. The hotel is a ~8 minute walk from the Airport subway stop. The walk is through a nice park so was great in good weather / during the day. I am not sure I would want to walk it at night. Breakfast was good. The hotel cautions you to arrive before nine but it was not horribly busy after nine either. A couple of days we took breakfast up to our rooms - no one minded that we took the plates/cutlery with us. If you want an omlette, be prepared to wait. The price is right for Boston hotels if you want to stay in the city but THERE IS NOTHING anywhere near the hotel. Any decent restaurant etc is a subway right back into town. After a long day playing the tourist, it was a pain to go back to hotel to shower/change and then go back into town. A couple of night, we just ordered from local restaurants - the front desk will give you take out menus from a variety of places. The room was small for a suite and only had a small sink, fridge and microwave. Parking at the hotel (and everywhere in Boston) is costly. At the hotel it is $32/day. On our first day, we parked at the hotel and then went into town and checked in later. On our last day, we asked at the front desk if we could leave our car there for the day (and got permission) so we saved the parking fees for our last day too). Make sure you get the front desk clerk to note it on your parking ticket. Pool and hot tub are small. Staff were great. While the hotel is near the airport, there is NO issue with noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice by the airport”
Reviews.Author: urbanmamma
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after landing late in the evening. The hotel is very close to the airport and the rail station. They have a shuttle service that is excellent!!!!!!! The drivers were friendly and helpful and quick. We were always picked up very quickly when we called. We just spent one day visiting the city before we headed out and because the shuttle was so handy we delayed renting a car for a day. We had a great room and there was no airport noise. They had a great free breakfast with an omelet bar and numerous hot and cold choices. Great coffee and drink selections.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very convenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: KingBugaloo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night before an early flight. Loved it. Nice suites, comfortable beds. Lots of options at their breakfast which is included in the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat this Place!”
Reviews.Author: toomuchtravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights while on a New England and Canada tour with family (wife and two sons 11 and 8) and then 1 more night at the end of the trip prior to our flight out of Logan. This place is minutes from Logan Airport (complimentary shuttle) and a less than 10-minute walk from the subway line (airport station). The subway is the best way to see the city. We dropped our rental car while in Boston (as part of a long trip) and used the subway. We had a typical sized Embassy suite, with plenty of space. There is a coin-op laundry room, which came in handy (you only have to pack half the clothes and then do laundry one night!). The breakfast was very good - typical Embasy or better, with plenty of options. The breakfast staff were very helpful and friendly. The evening reception was way beyond typical Embassy, with awesome appetizers (more than just chips and popcorn). The bell and valet parking staff offered assistance beyond what I've typically seen before - they are truly there for the guests. The indoor pool is average size and provided lots of fun for the kids. The hot tub was niced and hot. The wireless internet connection was superb. The hotel is soundproofed very well and there is not much, if any, airplane noise. The only off site dining option was a great neighborhood pizza place (Santarpio's) about three blocks away. There is a park across the street (on the way to the subway) where kids could use energy if they need to. I give this hotel one of my highest recommendations and will most likely stay here on any future visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: wheretogo1404
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and accomadating. It was very close to the T line which takes you every where you want to go. They have a shuttle to the T line but we walked through a nice, turf, sports park located across the street from the hotel to the T line. My children spent some free time at the park playing soccer and watching games. Breakfast was cooked to order and included in the price of the room. The rooms were on the smaller side for an Embassy Suites, but accomodated the five of us fine. When we go back to Boston, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super comfortable!!”
Reviews.Author: pjm24Co
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay. The bed was super comfortable! The room was clean and it is just a very short walk through the park to the train! Staff was friendly. Will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Very good hotel, I will stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: dad_first
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the airport. However, unlike the Hilton one cannot walk from the terminal to this hotel. There is a free shuttle available. My flight was delayed and we arrived a little after 9:00 PM. It took me about an hour to get someone to pick up the phone at the front desk to request the shuttle. Once we connected everything went smoothly. Once at the hotel the check in was quick and I was in my nice suite in no time. The room was actually a small suite and was quite and comfortable. All room rates include hot breakfast which was convenient but average. The juice was average and the coffee was mediocre. The eggs were cooked to order and was the best part of the breakfast. The hotel was a five minute walk from the hotel. This was a great plus as I did not need to rent a car and deal with driving in Boston area. Over all a good hotel, if not for the wait for the shuttle, I would have given this property five stars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel by the airport”
Reviews.Author: benhochschwender
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at This hotel twice now and both times were for flying out the next day. It Is nice to be close to the airport for when you fly out the next morning. They have a shuttle service that transports from the hotel to the airport. We have not run into any problems with the shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Laudie65
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit & I have to say that I was thoroughly impressed by the Embassy Suites Hotel-Boston Logan Airport. Every person in the staff that I interacted with was friendly & helpful. My son & I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. The location is good. It is close to the airport & a short walk (probably less than 10 minutes) to a subway station. We learned fast that Boston is very easy to get around on by foot & subway. The room was very comfortable & quiet. The accomodations were nice. No problems with the shuttle service to & from the airport-both trips were quite timely. The breakfast was very nice, and all items were fresh. We also enjoyed the manager's reception nightly. The selection of fresh veggies & cheese were quite nice, and nightly the selection of fresh quiches and tarts changed. This was a good way to get a bite to eat & keep going until having a late dinner every night during our stay in Boston. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and will stay there on my next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy hotel, with bad Internet and expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: Blaavand
Reviews.Content: Embassy Suites is a very nice hotel. Our room was like a small apartment with two rooms, and a bathroom. Everything was super clean and very appealing. The metro station is located only five minutes from the hotel lobby, and it takes around 15 minutes with the metro to the centre of Boston. There are however a couple of downsides. There is only valet parking at the price of $32 pr. day. We got a parking-voucher of $25 by booking via expedia, which of course reduced the price considerably. Besides that the Internet was bad. At least on the American east coast it is more or less common to have free wifi in every room. This is however not the case for Embassy Suites Boston. Not even in the lobby was the wifi free. You could however pay around $10 pr. day for connection all over the hotel, or you could use one of the four computers in the "Business room" at the hotel. The Internet connection here was however very unstable and it took us a very long time just to check mail, and do research on what to do in Boston the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rioslyle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near the airport but within walking distance of the T line also they have a free shuttle that picks you up in the train station. The breakfast bar is excelent they offer something for everyone from omelets to fresh fruits. The employees are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: CherrySlurpees
Reviews.Content: What we were looking for in this hotel: Space for us all to spread out Decent breakfast (not just carbs) Ease of getting to city My sister, two teenage nephews and I were stopping in Boston after a road trip to Nova Scotia that included 2 quick nights at hotels in Maine, staying with family in Nova Scotia, a trip to the ER and entirely too much time spent in the car. We needed some SPACE. And with the Embassy Suites we got exactly what we were looking for. With two double beds in the bedroom and a pull out sofa in the living room, we all had our own space and didn't encounter that end of the trip "you're all getting on my nerves" issue that sometimes occurs. The breakfast was much better than what we'd encountered at a different chain in Maine. We had eggs, bacon, sausage, omelets, fruit, pancakes, waffles, etc. Plenty to fill up two growing boys before a day of exploring Boston. The manager's reception at night was also a great snack before heading off again. The shuttle service to the airport/T Station/rental car agency was superb. We never had to wait longer than 10 minutes for it to arrive - even on the 4th of July after the fireworks. Other pluses: the front desk staff was fantastic. Ysmael was very accommodating. The housekeeping staff was very pleasant. The shuttle drivers were extremely friendly and helpful. The pool was a nice size for the kids to horse around in (not very deep at all though). The 24 hour fitness room was a huge plus. Though I've stayed at various Embassy Suites for business, I believe Embassy Suites may be our go to hotel for our family vacations. Absolutely fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to see 4th fireworks”
Reviews.Author: Travelman360
Reviews.Content: With a room on the Boston skyline side you can see the fireworks without getting into the crowds. Nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “So convenient for a family trip to Boston!”
Reviews.Author: dudette77
Reviews.Content: I weighed our options for our family of five, and I really kept coming back to Embassy Suites Logan airport! I'm so glad we booked this hotel! First of all, other reviewers are right...you really cannot hear any planes from your room. Our window had a beautiful view of the Boston skyline...so amazing! Of course, like all Embassy Suites, they have a great breakfast that comes with your room price...there was something to please every type of eater in our family! Oatmeal and fruit selections for the weight conscious, eggs, omelets and breakfast meats for the protein craver, and pancakes or donuts and cereal for a picky second grader. On the weekend the breakfast is open til 10:30 a.m., but on the weekday it is only open til 9. Our last day we had some sleepyheads, so dad just ran down and brought a plate of donuts up to the room for them. The best part was how close this was to the 'Airport' subway terminal! Embassy Suites provides a shuttle from the airport, and after reading about the subway in Boston, we opted to not even rent a car. The subway (T) is literally a short (5-8 minute) walk across one of the most beautiful play parks and soccer field we've ever seen! Every day our youngest insisted on stopping for a moment to splash in the play fountain or climb on the playground equipment. Don't want to walk? No problem...the hotel provides a free shuttle around the block and drops you off at the door of the subway station. When you return in the evening, just call the hotel lobby and they will send the shuttle around for you. We did this on a late evening when it was raining. Other amenities were nice...kids loved the pool, cookies at the front desk each night along with a early evening reception. The pull-out bed is the only negative...it would be comfy enough for a child or teenager, but for us adults it wasn't supportive enough. It was our choice though...we wanted a room to ourselves and let the kids have the nice beds! Lastly, our hotel housekeeper was wonderful! We left her a small tip each day, and she got more and more creative in her special touches on the room...stuffed animals arranged on the beds, and extra snacks and a sweet note.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but way over priced”
Reviews.Author: expatrick
Reviews.Content: The propery is older, somewhat outdated, but clean and comfortable. I found the prices quite high for such an average property. My room was quite small compared to most Embassy Suites. The restaraunt and parking are quite expensive, so you would never think of the propery as a bargain. On a more positive note, I did find the staff to be helpful and attentive, and breakfast was decent. I suspect most guests are business travelers that are not concerned about costs. I will look for a more cost effective alternative next time I bring my family to Boston, as the Metro System makes it quite easy to stay a bit further out where hotels are much more affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Problem solved”
Reviews.Author: Margot900
Reviews.Content: Our first night was a nightmare due to night construction outside in the neighboring rental car lot. It was bothering our daughter, and thus none of us got much sleep. Why they had to work at night adjacent to a hotel beats me. Be sure to request a room away from the site. The work should be completed, but check. Only one side of the hotel is impacted. The excellent rating is for the care and attention Elaine, the manager, provided in resolving the situation. We were moved the next day to a much better room, and on our return a few days later, we also had a super room. The staff is friendly and helpful. A true measure of service is in how a problem is handled. The hotel is convenient to the subway line and to the airport. You can walk t5 mins to the station for the blue line subway. $2 per person each way. Kids free. Takes you to heart of Boston. Breakfast is very good. I do not suggest dinner, unless you have no other options. It is much better to go dowtown.

Reviews.Title: “Valet wrecked my car”
Reviews.Author: skiadct
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here to utilize the Park n Fly option. The stay was fine, service was good with valet but returned from a 2 week trip and the valet pulled up with my car and says "here you go", and I find a HUGE dent in the driver's door with the paint peeling off and damaged handle that was not there when I left it with the valet. There's no way the valet did not notice this damage when retrieving my vehicle (unless he did it). Beware of parking here. At least there was absolutely no argument as to the liability for damages and the manager is helping to take care of the cost with my local body shop, something that I'm not sure would happen with a lesser hotel. Clearly once the valet takes your keys they should be responsible. What a hassle to deal with this after a long trip and have to interrupt my work schedule with this.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to park and fly!”
Reviews.Author: ccsweeps
Reviews.Content: We booked an overnight stay for a park and fly. They stored our auto and brought us to the airport in plenty of hassel free time! They were quick to pick us up 7 days later and our car was warm and waiting when we got back to the hotel! We will definitely use this service again!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: UALsandiego
Reviews.Content: The free breakfast alone makes it worth staying at Embassy Suites! But this one was actually quite nice. Large suite, and any needs I had were taken care off quickly. The shuttle service was very reliable as well. Lots of families and flight crews stay here. Front desk staff was very friendly. The also have a pool, which is always fun after a long day. The place is far from downtown, so don't stay here if you are in Boston to sightsee or for business in downtown. If you have a flight in the morning, I would say stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right next to Logan”
Reviews.Author: dchi50
Reviews.Content: While the price was a little high, if you are looking for a business hotel right next to Logan with great access to the city and good service it is a good choice. To get to the Blue Line on the T all you have to do is walk 5 minutes through a park.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Lizmats
Reviews.Content: We found a great rate on hotels.com, but were a bit discouraged because we were not going to be right in the city. However, from the moment we arrived we were wonderfully surprised by the service, room and amenities. The room was spacious, clean and beautiful. They provide a free and fabulous breakfast until 10:30AM for any late risers. In the early evenings, they also have a small spread of light appetizers for guests. Free! We complained to the cleaning lady about one of our pillows and she quickly accommodated us and then she handed us a free voucher for a movie rental. I called for a roll-away, because we ended up with an unexpected guest and they only charged us for one night. The T stop is a 3 minute walk and two stops into the city. This will be our place to stay in Boston! Especially since city hotel rates are crazy!

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back everytime I come to Boston”
Reviews.Author: hemiman9950
Reviews.Content: All of their staff are freindly ,helpful and courteous. The desk agents cannot do enough to make your stay pleasurable.The morning Chefs are fantastic and make any kind of omlet you can think of. The hotel is close to the airport and the shuttles will take you to the "T" (subway) or you can walk through the park across the street.

Reviews.Title: “great Logan airport hotel close to the subway T to downtown”
Reviews.Author: michroch
Reviews.Content: Everything was great ,free breakfast ,fast own embassy only airport shuttles 24hr, near the subway T blue line to the city,clean and big room with fridge and comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Odd to say but; â€œPleasant stay at an Airport Hotelâ€�?”
Reviews.Author: HareWeGo
Reviews.Content: Embassy Suites Boston Logan is located in the sea of airport rental car lots at Logan Airport. The interesting fact about this location is just that, its location. Although located next to Logan International Airport, itâ€™s a 1 minute drive to the I90 tunnel (Toll) into Boston. Hotel to South Boston office was just 6 minutes. It is also an eight minute walk to the Blue-line â€œTâ€� Airport station, (10 to 15 minute ride to Faneuil Hall and the N.E. Aquarium. Having these forms of transportation available to you to get into Boston will tend to make you forget youâ€™re staying out at an airport hotel. Even the hotel construction is extremely solid that you will NOT hear the aircraft coming and going. I was located on the 10th floor and had zero noise issues with the room. Like other Embassy Suites, cook to order breakfast, manager afternoon specials, pool and gym, (neither used for one night). Hotel is very clean and spacious as expected from this hotel chain. Typical Boston standard, Valet parking ($$$$). Boston averages about $30 per night valid for most hotels, this location is no different. Or is it? My stay had â€˜an eventâ€™ regarding valet. More a minor inconvenience at best. However the important part was managementâ€™s response to the event. I took advantage of their online survey and preceded with protocol by sending in the survey with details of the event that occur. It took no more than two businesses days that I received responses from Hotel management, regional management and even the Valet Manager. Although I received a credit for my parking which was a nice jester, it was the responses I received from management that had the most value. Interesting to note, without any reply from hotel management with my stay and the event that occurred would warrant a challenging review. However by ensuring awareness and extending themselves by responding to my experience shows the importance on selecting the right hotel for your stay. This is the right hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to airport - great rooms”
Reviews.Author: fbrusca
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after we arrived in and just before we flew out of Logan Airport. Five minutes away by shuttle bus. Check-in took one minute. Our rooms were very roomy, immaculately clean and quiet. On our return we were upgraded to a very large suite. Our room service waiter even brought my daughter a complimentary ice cream sundae. Another thing to note... The Budget, Hertz and Avis lots are across the street. If you;re renting a car, this hotel couldn't be any more convenient. The breakfast buffet was the best I've ever seen. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Suite not so Sweet”
Reviews.Author: Zaihera
Reviews.Content: I have had the opportunity to stay at this hotel twice and each experience different. I will review my last stay there in July 2010. My fiance and I reserved to stay in one of the executive suite, but due to over capacity was given the handicap room with view of a brick building and parking lot. We are not handicap so needless to say, the trouble started there. Upon entering the room, there was an awful smell. I notified the front desk and they sent someone up to open the windows for me. Kudos to the express service. On appearance the room looked clean, but really it wasn't. Dust was everywhere and the bathroom floors had mold. Not a good sight. Things got worse when I took a shower. Yikes. The drain (located across the room; keep in mind it is a handicap room) overflowed and had water come from the opposite side of the bathroom. A nighmare. They ended sending someone to address the problem and I have to admit, watching the plumber/handy man open up the drain was one of the grossiest things I've ever seen. Sleeping: Bed was uncomfortable and the sheets didn't feel clean. Food: Complimentary breakfast was a perk. Catering for event: Excellent and accomodating; 5 stars. Parking: Valet only and between that and a tip; we basically paid for the breakfast that was free Overall, a disappointment with the (handicap) room. However, if you are looking to host an event at the hotel this is the right place, the food/service/hospitality was top of the line...perhaps just get another room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if visiting Boston”
Reviews.Author: delwy
Reviews.Content: Following on from other reviews for this hotel, I was on business recently from the UK and found this hotel met all my requirements and expectations.great place to base yourself and the hotel staff were always willing to assist in making my visit as pleasant as possible. Would definitely recommend both from a sightseeing, business perspective with excellent transport links to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Good location, Great service”
Reviews.Author: kenstef96
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Boston and were very pleased with our stay at Embassy Suites Logan Airport. Jeannette at the front desk made our stay very comfortable and took care of our every need. Many reviews I read before the trip proved to be true about the park across the street on the way to the T. I recommend buying the $15 one week T pass if you plan to be there a few days. I also recommend the Boston Go Card if you are adventurous and have lots of energy to squeeze in lots of activities...well worth the money. The Beantown Trolley tour with Eric Johansen was fabulous...very funny guide. Back to the hotel, we made maximum use of the fitness center, pool and spa. Finally, we really enjoyed both the breakfast and evening manager's reception. We actually ate big lunches each day and used the manager's reception for our dinner snack and saved lots of money.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Decent”
Reviews.Author: luzsbrain
Reviews.Content: So I was booked at this hotel for an expo at the convention center. The only thing they expo people told me breakfast was included and we had to pay valet. Well upon arrival valet took a while but it was saturday and seemed to be a busy night, the expo started on sunday. At first they gave me a room with a single bed when I requested a double. We went back down stairs and they quickly gave us another room. We checked into the room and it was great, we didnt even notice the sofa was a bed as well. It was a nice suite, micro and fridge in there and the beds were comfortable. Being near the airport I thought we would hear planes all night and that was not the case at all. There were a bunch of noisy people talking loudly, running down the halls and slamming doors, but that was not the hotels fault. It stopped eventually. We ate dinner at the hotel since we couldnt really find any restaurants near by, it was average priced for a hotel. We did have a little error on our check they fixed right away when we checked out. In the AM we were surprised by the breakfast. It was not just muffins and bagels. There was an omelet station, buffet style breakfast - homefries, toast, grits, you name it. They had ceral, fruit, waffles, pancakes,... etc.. I was super impressed with the breakfast. That alone was worth the stay! The valet parking was expensive, $32 for the night, but turned out they gave us an expo special discounted rate. They offered a shuttle bus to the convention center which was cool but I didnt use it. I would stay here again for the expo next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service!”
Reviews.Author: annasmom73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Park & Fly special before our trip. We pulled up to the hotel, and our car was briskly taken away by the valet, our bags brought up to our room (which was upgraded by the hotel), and we started our vacation! The room was so spacious, it was great for our two small children, they had room to move, and we had room for sanity. We ordered room service, the service was fast, the food delicious. We barely heard the jets taking off at the airport. We had a few items that needed to go into the car before we left; we left the bag with the valet, and he made sure it made it safely to the car without a second thought. Wonderful. The shuttle and shuttle driver were prompt and helpful, even laughing along with us as he put our huge luggage, carseat bags and stroller bag into the shuttle. Dropped us right at our airline, and off we went. When we returned, we called the number they gave us, gave our car #, waited about 6 minutes for the shuttle. We were driven right back to the hotel, our car was waiting and we were homeward bound! WOW! What service! We used to stay at another hotel for our park&fly, but not anymore. We're sold! Great value...we paid about what we would pay to park for the week at a satellite lot at Logan. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service at its BEST!”
Reviews.Author: UTMama23
Reviews.Content: Coming from Texas, I'm used to our world reknown Southern Hospitality, so when I travel north, I go expecting the worst. This hotel experience, however, proved me wrong. Not knowing what to expect of Boston, I called ahead of time approximately 15 times, and always got a person at the reception who was willing to go above and beyond with details abt what to expect from the city. Very, very helpful. The free breakfast - superb. And the timings are perfect for those of us who begin our day late(r). The pool area was always clean and the hot tub one of our favorite ammenities! The best, and most helpful, part of the whole experience was the free shuttle from the airport. So timely and with the friendliest drivers. Also, the shuttle transported us from the hotel to the T station, so that we could see the city!!! Would def saty here again, and rec that you do too!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Convenient, and Lots of Freebies”
Reviews.Author: toolworker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight as an alternative to hopping in a rental car after a late evening arrival. This was a brilliant idea that we will repeat in the future. The free shuttle arrived at the terminal in about 15 minutes. (The word "free" is one of my favorites and you will notice it quite a bit in this review.) During check-in, and throughout our stay, the front desk was well-trained and friendly. Their skill at multitasking compensated well for being understaffed. It was the fastest check-in I've ever seen - keys were all ready and they didn't even have to swipe my credit card. Our suite had a living room so my wife could watch TV while I slept. It had free wired and wireless internet. HHonors membership got us free chips and bottled water in room; cookies and fruit at the front desk. The restaurant was nothing special but we got quite an adequate dinner at a reasonable price, which was satisfying at the end of our long flight. Next morning there was a decent free breakfast buffet with an excellent omlette station. After breakfast, we walked an easy 50 yards to the Hertz office and were on our way, refreshed, relaxed, and having saved one day of rental that mostly paid for the room. Convenient, comfortable, and a great deal. Couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Arrived for our early AM flight totlly relaxed thanks to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DuncanH
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a Park, Stay and fly as we had an early AM flight and inclement weather may have made a very early commute to airport stressful. Upon arrival the valet immediately took our car and handed us a ticket with return pickup instructions. He was professional and courteous. We tipped him. Our check in too only a minute or so and we were on our way to our room on the ninth floor. The suite was a decent size with a separate sitting room. The bed was comfortable and everything was as it should be. The bedroom phone was dead, but no worries as the sitting room one worked. After getting settled we decided to go downstairs to eat. We fully expected with the bar/dining area empty that the food and service would be mediocre. The food amazed us with my hamburger and fries of top quality, while my wife's crab cakes were top notch. We had a restful night, though there was some noise in the corridors. something one cannot blame the hotel for. (Why can't people show some consideration for their fellow guests?) In the morning we availed of the included buffet breakfast which offered many choices. While the standard of the food here did not quite measure up to what we had the previous evening, it was plentiful and served its purpose. When we came to the lobby area some time later, we were immediately taken to our designated terminal at Logan. The trip was perhaps four minutes or less. Upon returning to logan from our trip, we called the number given to us by the valet and were asked to wait outside for the shuttle. I would say it took less than three minutes to arrive and when we returned to the hotel, our car (completely free of snow from the mega blizzard) was waiting for us and the valet helped us with our bags. Please tip these great valets and drivers, as they provide great hassle free experiences. We will definitely us this hotel for future early AM flights. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent rooms, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: jjstagner
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice surprise - right next to Logan Airport, beautiful rooms, very clean, and very quiet. We were traveling with two young children and lots of luggage - several of the staff members went out of their way to assist us with our baggage, car return and transport to the airport. For anyone traveling with young children and lots of luggage, this was a blessing. Good breakfast included. Overall, an excellent value and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent everything”
Reviews.Author: Johngil
Reviews.Content: The location was great. Subway very close. Even though it rained most of our time, it still was a great time. The free breakfast was made to order and excellent. I was on a course in the hotel for 2 weeks and my family came down for 5 days. We had an amazing time and got to enjoy all of the sights that Boston offered. Can't wait to go back to Boston and will definantly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCEPTIONAL EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: dammish30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites last week after returning from Orlando. We utilized the Park and Fly package. Valet parking is quick and included in the price of park and fly. You basically pull into the front of the hotel, hand your keys off to valet and hop the van for a 1/2 mile ride to the airport. Shuttle driver very pleasant! On return from Orlando, picked up our bags from baggage claim, called the Embassy and van was waiting within 5 minutes. Hotel is beautiful and very clean. Managers reception every night with light hot and cold appetizers, soda, milk, juice, fresh chocolate chip cookies at the front desk. Just enough for a "pick me up" prior to deciding what to have for dinner. Room was very clean and quiet and enough room for small family ... with separate living room. Housekeepers were kind enough to bring us new sheets at 230 am after our daughter had been sick ... she even made the bed for me. The next morning, we were greeted with what can only be deemed as the most unbelievable breakfast buffet ever! Scrambled eggs, omelet station, sausage, belgian waffles with all the fixings, fresh fruit bar, muffins, donuts, danish, home fries, coffee, juice, milk, 4 types of cereals along with hot oatmeal. It is definitely ALL that they promise. Love the Embassy for this reason! Absolutely NO complaints and would highly recommend. This is exactly why we have the Hilton Honors American Express Card. Love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, average room”
Reviews.Author: DebDunn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the airport and car rental sites. The room was large and clean, the furniture and decor were a bit dated. Internet connection was not free and a bit problematic. Parking was $30

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Marine21_10
Reviews.Content: The embassy suite is spacious and very corfortable. Must have the breakfast omelette they are amazing. The only down side is that they don't have a parking lot so you have to pay for valet parking each night you are there. The hotel is nice but the location is not that great since it is surrouded by rental car companies.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites 12/2009”
Reviews.Author: blueskies15-10
Reviews.Content: fairly new hotel. Is part of the Hilton Group, Neighbourhood not so nice and a little dangerous at night, but not far to the blue line subway. Rooms are very comfortable and equipped wit hall nessecities. Free WiFI, very good breakfast in very nice surroundings, breakfast cooked to order and was included in the room rate, had no car, so cannot speak about parking.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, excellent service, fine rooms”
Reviews.Author: tea_thyme
Reviews.Content: We came here on Columbus Day weekend because it had the best price/location mix in Boston, and we completely enjoyed our stay. We were returning from a cruise, and the location between the cruise pier and the airport was ideal. It was easy to go into central Boston from here. The hotel is very attractive and features a good restaurant. Breakfast offerings were very complete. The rooms were stylish and comfortable. I'd return any time!

Reviews.Title: “Meh.”
Reviews.Author: Yoyoy
Reviews.Content: The hotel has all the amenities you need --pool/ fitness center, bar/restaurant and free breakfast. The rooms are large and comfortable, with in-room microwave and mini-fridge; but the furnishings are chipped and the carpet is worn. The bed is overly soft -- like sleeping in a sling -- and the pillowcases are made out of some stiff, yucky material. You hear the toilets flush from the adjacent rooms, and your own toilet is VERY loud in your own room. This hotel caters to business clients, yet it does not offer an in-room safe. They do offer safes at the front desk, but not large enough to accommodate a laptop; I was told I could leave my computer in the manager's office -- "lots of people do that." Sorry, but that just doesn't feel secure to me. The location is poor. Yes, it's close to the airport, but not to anything else in Boston. It's surrounded by rental car lots. A cab to the North End will cost $30 one way (the concierge explained to me that taxis have to go thru an underwater tunnel, which has a toll), so the only other option is to take the T, back and forth. The hotel does run a shuttle to the T station, 24/7, so props to them for that. What really irked me, though, was that on my first morning, I found a flier under my door asking me to write a favorable review for a $10 credit (which, incidentally, can only be used on food, internet service -- which costs $10 a day! -- or valet parking.)

Reviews.Title: “Great location; scrumptious breakfast; quiet nights”
Reviews.Author: travelover25Texas
Reviews.Content: There were 5 of us. Although the sofa bed was a bit uncomfortable (aren't they all?), we were happy to be able to stay in one room. Breakfast was great -- made-to-order eggs/omelets, waffles, pancakes, fruit, pastries, etc. The staff couldn't have been better. They were quick to accommodate us at every turn. The airport shuttle was slow sometimes at night, because they make runs through the airport to pick up incoming passengers before stopping at the "T" station. But, the hotel is within very easy walking distance to the "T."

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near the airport”
Reviews.Author: ZPhair
Reviews.Content: It was the perfect place for my husband and I and my friend to stay. The hotel staff was extremely helpful answering all our questions about sightseeing and getting into the city on the "T". There was a computer room so we could print out our tickets ahead of time for our departure flight. The breakfast was very good. There were lots of choices,fresh fruit, and omelettes cooked at the grill. The bar served food late so that we were able to get dinner the first night at 10:30 pm after our flight from CA. Transportation to everything was easy. The shuttle was always available to get to the airport, which made access to the silver line on the "T" very easy. There is also a "T" stop close by. It did take about 15-20 minutes to get into the heart of Boston on the "T", but that was not a problem. We took the 2 day tram ride around the city, and they even pick you up and drop you off at the hotel. Another great location feature was that Hertz rental was just across the street so it is easy to pick up and return your rental car if you are going out of Boston. The rooms themselves are clean, comfortable and roomy-great for a couple and a friend traveling together. If you didn't want to eat in the hotel restaurant and didn't eat in the downtown area, there is a great pizza parlour just two blocks away Santarpios. It's always packed so be prepared to stand in line. The pizza is the best! This was my first stay at the Embassy Suites in Boston; if I get back there again, it will be my choice of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and convienent to T Line”
Reviews.Author: jamesnps
Reviews.Content: After renting a car and driving from Stamford, CT , to Provincetow..then ending in Boston for our last three days , Embassy Suites was great. We turned in our rental car knowing that the T -line stop was about 5 minutes from the hotel. The impressive customer service we recieved from the minute we pulled up was great. Our bellan asked if he could load up our bags, and that they would hold the rental ar while we cheked in and unloaded opuir baggage. then arranged the Embassy sujites shuttle to pick us up at the car rental place to bring us back after turning in the car. When we got in our room, (t was a AAA discounted suite was was a lot of space for tow people but great the callahan suite.) Our only situation here was that the hand held shower head tube was slit and we had to call maintenance to come up. no problem , I don't think it was 10 minutes before someone came and repaired it. The full breakfast avaiable each day was a nice touch, as we weere usually off and running to the t line to explore the city. I am sure this hotel is mostly used for business clients, but was otfitted wit a nice fitness gym, pool and jacuzzi and restaurant. it was a breeze to get to the airport our day of checkout and a wonderful ending to a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: travelinggringo
Reviews.Content: I don't get all the "awesome" reviews of this hotel. For us It was just okay for the price. The pros: Easy access to Boston Logan. Easy access to the Airport T Station. Rooms are okay - larger than the Hyatt, but still seem small for an Embassy Suites. Decent breakfast (for free.) Good shuttle service. Friendly shuttle drivers and dining staff. The cons: Rooms were not immaculate - carpets very stained and fraying at the seems, wall paper peeling - tiles taped together with masking tape in the bathroom. Staff does not seem to communicate AT ALL with each other. They seem to have a problem overbooking their hotel and not having staff or rooms to accommodate. Very small pool - only 3 - 3.5 feet deep. No convenience stores nearby. The restaurants and bar close early - no late night room service. If you arrive into BOS late, grab a bite and any incidentals that you might need at the airport. They do have a small store in the hotel, but it is overpriced and pickings are slim. (A pack of Ibuprofin (two pills) cost $3.00.) For the price in the Boston area, this hotel was just okay - not awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay with somecomplaints”
Reviews.Author: SPman00
Reviews.Content: The embassy suites at Logan was a decent place, the bedding and TVs are new and I never heard any noise when I was trying to sleep. The location is very, very good with the property being adjacent to the airport and next to the T. The price was stiff, but didn't seem out of line for the area. I do have some minor complaints : Took forever to pick us up from the airport (could have just taken a taxi). We called and they said "we'll send the driver right over" and I had to call back 30 minutes later to find out where the driver is. That's not enjoyable late at night. Breakfast was the worst I've ever had at an Embassy, there was an extremely long line for omelets, the coffee was awful, and the juice never seemed to taste right. All the pastries were stale and the bacon was flimsy. There was also no alcohol served at the "managers reception". I don't know if this is an Embassy issue or a state issue, but it was dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “This place is AWESOME!!!!”
Reviews.Author: goldie740
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff! Very clean room. These people go above and beyond to make your day and your stay relaxing and full of adventure! The breakfast was perfection (hats off to the omelette chef). Bruno should get a raise (or at least acknowledgment) for his winning attitude and his attention to to detail. Also,keep in mind that Bars etc close around midnight, so contact Woody's for delivery. They are in the area and will deliver right to your door. I will be back and highly recommend this hotel. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed, convenient to the airport.”
Reviews.Author: cactusdog
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides a comfortable bed in a clean, spacious 2-room suite. Property is quiet and very convenient to the airport. Complimentary breakfast in the morning is excellent and includes a full omelet bar.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location -- Great Service -- Nice Facilities”
Reviews.Author: FoxTraveler
Reviews.Content: Great Location and Value When Visiting Boston -- wife and oldest son (24) spent week in Boston on Vacation. After much searching chose hotel give size of room and ability to have our son have his own space (couch into bed). Upgraded online to get bigger room and was allowed to do so. Rooms - rooms are very nice, quiet (given next to airport) and extremely comfortable. Food -- brekfast is included, cook to order omlettes and quite a large selection. ou can eat breakfast abd not have to eat lunch given the amount of food. Breakfast is from 0600 to 0900. There is a Manager's Social from 5:30PM to 7:30 PM and has heavy pu'pus (eats) and soft drinks. Beer and Wine is extra and can be purchased at the bar. Location -- truly a 3/5 minute walk to the Metro across a very nice park...you can get anywhere on the metro and we used it the entire week. We did all the sites/events of Boston and the metro made it easy. You can get a 7-day Metro pass for $15.00. Hospitality -- Embassy Suites goes out of their way to make sure you truly enjoy your stay. We looked at multiple hotels and am very happy we chose this hotel for the room, location, and food that was included. I'd definitely stay here every time I traveled to Boston. Departure -- the hotel has a free shuttle to the airport and it is a 3-minute ride.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for the Airport with easy access to Boston”
Reviews.Author: Aardvarksheep
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in early July following a flight from London - didn't have to wait too long for a courtesy bus and check-in was fast. We had a King Suite which consisted of a huge bed in one room and a large sofa bed in the other room. The beds were really comfortable but the air conditioning was rather noisy. Breakfast was included in our rate and there was a good choice including wonderful omlettes. The walk to the nearby T station (Airport) took about 10 minutes across the Memorial Park (slightly longer if there were games taking place as you have to walk around the edge of the playing area. A real bonus was a great pizza place called Santarpios, which has been mentioned in previous reviews, which was about 10 minutes walk away (turn left out of the hotel & keep walking. It's very popular and you may need to queue - also be aware that they only take cash. All in all, a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: motherjanegoose
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I took a 3 day trip to Boston, before she heads to college. This was a wonderful place to stay. Right next to the airport but NO noise whatsoever. The shuttle picked us up quickly! It is a 5 minute walk to the T that is just 2 stops from the Aquarium and Quincy Market. Just through a lovely park that had a play area and water fountain. This would be grand for families with young children. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff was very helpful. The breakfast buffet was substantial and they even had light appetizers for dinner. If you ate a big lunch out, you could eat your other meals in and for FREE. We ate at a great restaurant in the North End: G'ivanni's on 2 Prince Street and it was delicious! A great stay and we would recommend it to anyone! No issues whatsoever at this hotel and I travel a lot for business, so I am picky! We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Blown away - perfect location for in/out Boston using the T”
Reviews.Author: rwethereyet850
Reviews.Content: Had stayed here once before but just a quick stop to catch a flight - to say that the staff far exceeded my expectations with this stay is an understatement. I had checked in on-line but arrived a bit early and that room was not ready. No problem -based on my HHonors Diamond status, I was given a corner suite that was really plush. Used the conference table in the room to lay out my clothes for the next day! I had chosen this hotel because of it's proximity to the Hertz rental car lot (right across the street). Makes it super easy to drop the car and step across for the night. Much to my pleasant surprise, the hotel is also within easy walking distance (5 minutes) to the airport T station - a must for getting around Boston. To get there, you walk through an extremely well-lit park with water area and a sweeeet artificial playing field for soccer. Although I called the hotel shuttle to pick me up at the T station later that night, there were games still going on at 11 pm and walking back through the area would not have been a problem (several couples with children were doing it without fear but my feet were tired after walking around the North End and a Sox game!) Breakfast the next morning was standard Embassy fare - well-cooked and plentiful. While I had enjoyed my previous stay here, this recent experience has made this hotel a must-stay when I'm in the Boston area.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall stay with minor complaints”
Reviews.Author: LibraryGirl35
Reviews.Content: I came to Boston over the July 4th weekend and stayed at the Embassy Suites Boston Logan. The hotel was hard to find as I didn't know that you have to enter through the Airport in order to get to the hotel. Our GPS brought us right next to the hotel but the airport is gated off so we had to go back around to park. Check in was easy, and the rooms were nice. The rooms were very clean, but the room smelled too much like a cleaning product to be able to feel completely comfortable. Actually the entire hotel smelled like an overdose of cleaning products which isn't ideal for my son's allergies. Even though this hotel is located a bit outside of the city, it is close to subway making it easy to get into the city when we didn't feel like driving. When we did drive, Valet was quick to bring our car to us and helpful with directions in this confusing area. A free cooked breakfast for the entire family was definitely a plus, and having a pool to bring the kids too was also great. I would definitely stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent quality, fair price for Boston”
Reviews.Author: a_local_doctor
Reviews.Content: Our family (two adults, 13 year old, 5 year old) has stayed in Executive Suites in several cities, so decided to make this our Boston hotel. It's not as nice as some of the other Executive Suites we've stayed (smaller lobby, smaller rooms, seems somewhat older), but the location is great - only about a 10 minute walk to the Boston MTA which takes you everywhere. The breakfast buffets are a nice and much-appreciated feature. The room listed at $278 and with taxes came out to $313 a night, which seemed fair for Boston suites (especially when you include breakfast for 4). The airport shuttle runs 24 hours at about 15 minute intervals - only takes 5 minutes to get to your terminal. Our first room was across from a hallway air conditioning vent, which kept us cold the first night; the staff changed us quickly the next morning and were very professional about it. The restaurant at the hotel is mediocre and the pool is typical of Executive Suites (small), but overall a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for late night/early morning flights”
Reviews.Author: beemarcus
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late at the airport and it was nice to have only a 5 min shuttle ride to our hotel. The next morning I realized my car rental location was only a 5 min walk (most are it appears). Our departure was very early in the morning so we stayed here again the night before and of course returning the car was simple and getting to airport at 5:30 was also easy. This place was a bit more $ than i'd normally pay, but for the convenience, it was worth it. It appears there are only 2 hotels just outside the airport property, and this is one of them. Oh, our first room had great view of downtown Boston, and our 2nd one had a great view of the airport. It was frustrating to pay $10 for the Wi-Fi. I'm even a Hilton Honors member, but apparently not reach a holy enough status to get it free. They need to change that policy.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Niki47
Reviews.Content: What a ripoff. (and I really don't like that word but it was the only one that suits this hotel). We've stayed at Embassy Suites across the country and always felt we received good value. Not this time. After paying over $300 a night, they still charged $9.95 per internet connection!!! So if you had an ipod and a laptop, you had to pay for each one. And the Manager's reception featured only non-alcoholic beverages, something I've never seen in any other Embassy Suites. I don't drink but some of our party did and they were extremely upset. The room doors slammed shut with such a bang it woke you from a sound sleep. The rooms smaller than the normal Embassy Suites and were claustrophobic. To be fair, the staff was very nice and even though it was close to the airport you didn't hear the planes, but all in all, I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for Boston stay”
Reviews.Author: iggie394
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights while on a family vacation. The location is right next to the airport's rental car lots and across the street from a nice park with a track, playground and ball fields and the Airport blue line T stop. It is a short walk across the park to the t, and then 2 short stops on the blue line to the Aquarium stop where you can walk to Fanueil Hall very easily. The room is a decent size, though smaller than other suite hotels I've stayed at. It was clean, with plenty of towels. We did have to ask for more blankets and pillows, as my daughter used the sofa bed and there were no additional blankets or pillows in the room. There is a small fridge, microwave and sink in the room and plenty of mirrors, something appreciated when a family is trying to get ready with one bathroom. The bed was comfortable. The bedding was not high quality and the first night the sheets and blankets had a few holes but were clean. The room was very quiet -- we heard nothing from the hallway, adjoining rooms or the airport. The internet connection, which is $10 a day, was very slow and spotty. The pool was closed (just for the week we were there, which was a major disappointment to the kids.) The exercise room looked inadequate with 1 elliptical machine, 2 treadmills and some weight equipment. The breakfast, which is complimentary, was quite nice. There is a cooked-to-order omelet bar with fresh ingredients of your choosing. There is fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals, toast/bagels/English muffins, eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuits and gravy, grits, pancakes, hash, home fries, and a make-your-own waffle station. The manager's reception has appetizers -- it is less substantial than other suite places I've been, but ok for a snack. As others have mentioned, no free alcohol due to MA state law. Room services was pretty good -- standard fare and standard room service prices. There is a laundry room on the 4th floor, but I had to ask to find this out -- their info book does not mention this. Parking is by valet and is $32 a day. Overall, this was a good place to stay for us, and I would stay again. Overall, this was a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Park, Sleep Fly...perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Nanct
Reviews.Content: We recently booked a package through Trinity reservations for a Park, Sleep, Fly package. Rate was terrific- included one nights stay, up to 14 days parking , free breakfast and shuttle transfer. All went off without a hitch! Perfect location for our needs, excellent service. Our only complaint was that the furniture in living area was not made for comfort, but we we there really just to sleep, so not a problem. Bedding was great! In the evening, appetizers were set out, cold/hot beverages, mini crab cakes, mini tacos, fresh fruit, salsa and chips etc. Breakfast, included at the Embassy was amazing!! When we returned from our flight, we called the number provided and a shuttle picked us up in less than 5 minutes. We would book the Embassy again without hesitation!!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Out of the Way But Worth It”
Reviews.Author: Laptop00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here April 17-20 while in town for the Boston Marathon. We were concerned staying away from the downtown are would be a pain but with the T station so close it was no problem. We had reserved a room with 2 queen beds but only needed a king so at checkin we were upgraded to an executive suite. Didn't really need a board room table with 10 chairs but it was great having the extra room. With so many hotels offering free wireless internet I was a little suprised there was a fee! Every single staff person at the hotel was very friendly and helpful to us. We look forward to staying here again when we go back to visit Boston at a less crowded time.

Reviews.Title: “A safe and pleasant haven after a long trip”
Reviews.Author: Lubiere
Reviews.Content: I booked this one via Trinity Reservation for 170$ for 1 night and 10 days parking. Upon arrival, was greeted with warm cookies and a smile. The suite was quite nice, good kitchen, nice bedroom with king bed, 2 flat screen TVs, good bathroom. The lobby and atrium is quite big. Serves as restaurant for the free breakfast. This includes made to order eggs, buffet style offering, waffle making. The pool and gym were decent sized. The bar served a few interesting beers. The only thing which I was disatisfied. I clearly asked that my car be parked in the indoor parking lot (had some beers in there) and of all places, they placed it on the roof of the parkade!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Road-King777
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, clean/quiet rooms, and above all a very friendly staff. A short walk to the T station brings you to downtown Boston in 5 minutes. Small but well equipped fitness room with a running track across the street! The free breakfast is excellent - great eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Did Stay, Park, & Fly package - SO convenient!”
Reviews.Author: KyminNH
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in NH and our flight to Nassau was early in the AM out of Logan. We did some research and found this package and were so glad that we did! We got there at around 7pm and the valet checked in our car. We were checked in very quickly and our suite was very nice and clean. We ate the restaurant which was actually pretty decent! Shuttle was ready and waiting when we went down around 5:45. The only downfall was were unable to take advantage of the breakfast, which we hear is good! Upon our return we called the valet when we hit baggage claim and they were waiting for us outside. Our car was out front and all we had to do was transfer our bags into our car and off we went! My only suggestion would be to warm up the car (it was early March, still cold). We will definitely do this again when we fly out of Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: Argosdog
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 1:30 in the morning after 20 hours of travel and being re-routed to Boston. The beds were comfortable, the location couldn't have been more convenient and the service at the desk and shuttle were kind and helpful. The free breakfast was more than we expected and the kids loved it. For the price, it was an amazing value and a much needed comfortable night's sleep. Basic but clean and comfy. Expected much less for an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Park, Fly and Stay...Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: joycam45
Reviews.Content: We were flying out of Logan early in the morning so decided to stay in Boston. We got a great deal from Trinity for the Embassy Suites Hotel so we tried it. Have stayed at other hotels with this same deal before and this was by far the best. The hotel is clean, neat modern and nice. The rooms are beautiful with flat screen TVs in both rooms, miny kitchens, granite counters, comfy beds and linens and a great view of the city. They offered free hot and cold snacks between 5:00 and 7:00 and a great breakfast buffet at 5:00 AM so we were able to enjoy that as well. We ate at the restaraunt on site and it was good and resonable...the crab cakes were exellent! They valet your car when you ceck in and again when you return to retrive it. The shuttle comes every 15 minutes to bring you to the airport. It was a great experience all around...we were very happy with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Average Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jsmOklahomaCity
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with decent fitness room and indoor pool. Rooms had two flat screen tv.'s and new furniture but hallways and carpeting appears dated. Nice complimentary breakfast. Dinner from hotel restaurant was typically overpriced and below average. Most frustrating thing was a $10 nightly charge for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot for Logan flights”
Reviews.Author: germ
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night prior to a flight out of Logan Airport as part of a Park, Sleep, and Fly package. The highlight of this hotel for us was the great airport service. The morning of our flight, we were able to jump right on a shuttle (they had two shuttles running at the time) and were at the airport within a few minutes. When we arrived back from our vacation, we waited no more than 10 minutes for a return shuttle and our car was ready and waiting for us. All the shuttle / valet staff were very helpful with bags, directions and questions. Otherwise, this hotel is fine. We had a king suite, my wife and I on the king bed and my daughter in the other room on the pull out sofa. The suite was pretty spacious and fine for the one night we were there. The king bed comfort was OK (not great) and the room was fairly clean. Took my daughter to the pool and had some lint and paper floating in it, but not enough to discourage us from going in. Free breakfast buffet was decent enough. They had an omelet station which was nice. We got there too late to see what the complimentary evening reception was like. FYI - We booked this stay through a third party web site called Trinityreservations (found out about it reading a previous Trip Advisor review). The rate was significantly lower than the hotel's own web site Park, Sleep and Fly rate for that date and included up to 14 days of valet parking in the hotel garage. It was comparable in price to some of the hotels that aren't as close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Better then I expected, BY FAR.”
Reviews.Author: saltypearl
Reviews.Content: All the staff were really with it -- good attitude and competent. I left items in room and they put them in my car -- all waiting safely after 9 days. GREAT breakfast and easy access to T-station on the day before flying.

Reviews.Title: “A good, solid business travel value.”
Reviews.Author: BayStateBizTraveler
Reviews.Content: Flew in to Logan from Australia - 20-hour trip - arriving 9PM on a Thursday. The Embassy Suites was simple and easy to get to, clean, simple and basic. Everything worked; room service was a good value with basic foods, and the room was quiet and restful. A good, solid business travel value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Airport Convenience”
Reviews.Author: lazydaz429
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the ES before flying out of Logan early in the morning. Room was clean, well maintained, staff was helpful. We really enjoy the room setup with Embassy suites, we have a 2 year old and we can put her on the pullout and close the door and still be able to watch TV in our room. This was the perfect hotel for an airport location. Shuttle and Valet was easy to use and quick. We booked through park,sleep,fly so I think we got a really good deal on teh room plus parking. Would stay here again! there is also a local childrens playground within walking distance that my daughter loved!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate - But watch for Valet”
Reviews.Author: kmr9
Reviews.Content: Read this with the understanding that I am a huge fan of Embassy Suites, just not this one. Rooms are adequate and relatively clean. Breakfast was so so. Kids did not like the food. Omelet station layout is inadequate. No alcohol at manager's reception - so did not bother - snacks at these things are usually pretty poor. There is a charge for internet service. I have not had to pay for internet service at other Embassy hotels. Location is inconvenient if you are going into the city. You must walk through a park and soccer field to get to the T station. You can cut straight through if no one is playing, otherwise walk around. Finally, parking is extremely expensive given the location. The Valet was also nice enough to steal all of the change needed for the tolls. For the next trip, I will stay in Quincy or Braintree if driving. Hotels are less expensive, parking is free, and commute time is about the same.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly average”
Reviews.Author: ozcanuck
Reviews.Content: Had a one night stay here in mid-October on a layover. The room was expensive - over $200 US/night, and I guess I expected a little more from it. Indeed I've stayed at the airport Hilton for much less, and have gotten much more. \But - having said that, there were few surprises, the room was comfortable, large (although a bit awkward in terms of the TV placement, and served its purpose. We did check out the hotel/exercise area, but it was packed with kids so we gave it a miss. Likewise, the business centre was packed as well, and extremely hot (as noted in another review). I waited so long for one page to load that I just gave up - not worth my time. It appears to be a common problem - they really should do something about it. An early check-out saw us quickly on our way. I have few expectations for places like this, and I guess this hotel met most, if not all of them. It would be nice to have a surprise on occasion, however - just something that makes me want to come back to places like these. Would I stay here again? Sadly no, I will choose the airport Hilton or another brand next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: 2ChrisTravels
Reviews.Content: We booked our Park, Stay & Fly package through Trinity Reservations and got a fabulous rate for one-night stay, shuttle to/from terminal, INCREDIBLE breakfast, and 14 days covered parking. How can you go wrong? I heard some of the flight crews nit-picking on both of the shuttle rides about the shuttle service, the food, etc. but I think they are a different kind of traveler with a different expectation. This hotel/package was top shelf in our opinion, and we travel A LOT. The mattresses and pillows were excellent! We were able to take advantage of the breafkast at 5:30 am. We were minutes from the terminal. It was almost too good to be true, and Trinity Reservations is the way to go for bookings!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for quick stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: sukay1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Boston for 2 nights on our way to Africa (to break up the long flights). We were traveling with other friends and one of them suggested we stay at the Embassy Suites. I was skeptical about staying outside the city, however it worked out great. We were able to jump on the T and get to wherever we wanted quite easily. The staff at the Embassy Suites were wonderful. Very helpful with recommendations, directions, etc. We were also able to print out our flight tickets for our next leg in their business office. Although they aren't able to provide Happy Hour Drinks (The State doesn't allow free or discounted drinks), they had a nice appetizer spread in the evenings. And the breakfast buffet had a great selection of hot and cold foods. All in all, I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Stillacutie
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews we read on trip advisor. Overall it lived up to our expectations. The hotel was close to the "T" (mass transit), which was a big plus. They also had a shuttle from the airport which was very convenient. The hotel staff was friendly & helpful. The breakfast every morning was good, although some mornings there was a shortage of food, coffee, plates, glasses & silverware. The AC unit didn't seem to function. It would run almost non stop morning & night. It seemed like the thermostat was broken. Also the remote in the bedroom did not work. We reported both of these problems to the staff, and nothing was ever done. One day our room was never cleaned, the bed was not made, no fresh towels, or replenished with coffee for the coffee maker. Overall, we had a good experience. For the money we paid, I feel we got an adequate room and adequate service.

Reviews.Title: “This will work for a Boston vacation.”
Reviews.Author: AltaPat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Embassy Suites - Logan Airport from July 30 to August 13, 2009. Although the hotel is located at the Airport, there is a "T" just a 7 minute walk across an athletic field that is very convenient for getting you downtown in minutes. There is an excellent comprehensive review of the hotel dated June 7, 2009 by "LakersFan" entitled "Surprisingly Convenient to Boston Convention Center" that will give you all the details you need to know about this hotel. As there is really not much I can add to LakersFan's review, I'll attach some pictures of our suite. (I apologize for taking the suite pictures at night.) I should mention that we were quite impressed by the breakfast - there was everything you could possibly want to eat, the food tasted good, the items were replenished in a timely manner and the area was kept clean. The man to thank for all of this is Mr. Harrison Norrell, the Food & Beverage Director - he does a fantastic job! Mr. Norrell was also responsible for the evening reception, which was very satisfactory with a variety of items - we only wished we had made it back for the reception more often. The housekeeping staff always kept our suite clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. We also never had problems accessing the internet (free) in the business area and we appreciated that. The rate was $149.00 plus tax U.S. per night due to the long term stay. We had a great vacation and would highly recommend Embassy Suites - Logan Airport for a problem-free stay.

Reviews.Title: “Most everything was what you want in an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: ATAM
Reviews.Content: Rooms are exactly as advertised. They're super clean. Beds are hard but comfy. And breakfast was really quite good with made to order omelets and a selection of excellent fresh fruit. We bad a slight problem connecting with shuttle driver, but that happens. The only surprise was that they do not have any non-feather pillows on property. The staff is friendly and helpful. If feathers are okay for you, this is a fine choice for the night before or after a flight.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: chicks_rule
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights, very clean, beds were so comfortable. Quick walk to the T. Breakfast was excellent. Hotel was very quiet. Pool very small, only to 3 feet, but was refreshing. The outside windows to the pool area should be tinted. Lots of people walking by and staring inside, I found very odd and little uncomfortable. Air conditioner was very loud in the rooms. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient alternative to expensive downtown hotels”
Reviews.Author: CheeseMouse
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for families coming to Boston for sightseeing. We spent 4 nights at the hotel. We did not rent a car, it was fast and easy to ride the subway to downtown. The subway stop is a 3 minute walk from the hotel, or you can get a ride there on the hotel shuttle. The Avis, Hertz and Dollar lots surround the hotel, making it super convenient to rent a car for a day trip outside of the city. The hotel is close to Logan Airport, but we never heard the planes arriving/departing during our stay. Some of the rooms have a great view of downtown. One downside is that there are no restaurants or retail within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Above average”
Reviews.Author: time_traveler99
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean. Best of all it was very quiet! There was no airport or airplane noise at all. The breakfast was filling and good. It included an omlette station, fresh fruit, waffles as well as other usual standard breakfast items. The shuttle was consistently on time, with friendly courteous driver. Nice gym room and computer lab both open 24 hours. I was unable to print my boarding pass is my only complaint there. There are small locally owned grocery stores nearby as well as a cafe, all within walking distance. Ask the front desk to direct you. Not a perfect hotel but certainly above average.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to lay your weary head”
Reviews.Author: blerg
Reviews.Content: The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Family-reviewer
Reviews.Content: Good location- out of town, but across park from T station. Ticket into town cost $2 (one way). We crossed the park in the day and at night- felt perfectly safe- but I think there is a hotel shuttle if you are unsure. Spacious lobby/ bar area. Small pool and fitness centre- perfect for cooling down after a long train journey from NYC. Breakfast buffet very good. Selection of fruit/ cereal/ pancakes and pastries, and waffle machine. Also hot food from buffet and made to order omelettes. Never seemed very busy when we where there, but we did get up early to pack everthing in to our tight schedule. Suites comfortable and clean with coffee maker, microwave and small fridge for your own items. 2 double beds and sofa bed, so potentially could sleep 6, but that might be a squeeze! Enough room for 2 adults and 2 grown up kids (18 and 21)! Air conditioning a bit noisy, and shower a bit slow, otherwise this was very good value for money. Would definitely recommend and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites Stay”
Reviews.Author: LOOKOWL
Reviews.Content: During my stay at the hotel, there were coin operated washers and dryers available. Both were much larger than most hotels that I have been to. Washing and drying times are also more than I have experienced at other hotels. The internet (worked really well)was also free in the Business Center in the lobby. I cannot accurately recall whether or not the receipt and outgoing faxes were free. Appreciated the no pet policy, which made a difference in choosing to stay there a second time. Buffet breakfast was really good in comparison to many "free breakfasts" offered in other establishments - would agree that the later you wait the food tended to be dried out due to being kept warm during the entire breakfast timeframe. I thought the Manager's reception was also adequate, but same would apply as for the breakfast timeframe. I have been travelling for over 24 years, and have experienced worse.

Reviews.Title: “Some points to consider”
Reviews.Author: cam405
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. The suite was clean and the staff were on the whole friendly. The hotel has the usual high standard complimentary cooked to order breakfast and managers reception (only non alcoholic drinks are allowed under state law). If you buy a drink from the bar beware. I was charged $9.45 for a glass of wine and I did not see a list of prices displayed before I ordered. The hotel is a 5 to 10 minute walk from the train station which we used frequently. The walk is through a childrens play park and past a baseball ground. We did not feel intimidated at all and enjoyed watching the odd game. The transport system is excellent so I would not be put off staying here due to location as all parts of the city very readily accessed. The hotel only has an indoor pool which is very small and quite shallow. Max depth 3.5 ft. There is also a hot tub. Turn left on leaving the hotel and there is a hidden gem of a pizza place. $11.50 for 14 inch.The operation has to be seen. Go in the side entrance for take out. The guys in this place should have their own show. The crack/patter/banter was worth the cost of the pzza alone. Unfortunately whentravelling with a family laundry facilities are important. The hotel doesn't have a coin laundry although a laundry service is available

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport and downtown.”
Reviews.Author: maplehuggers
Reviews.Content: Great hotel conveniently located close to the airport and a short drive to downtown. Suites are roomy and comfortable. Extremely quiet and soundproof considering the closeness to the airport. Amazing hot buffet and cooked to order breakfast. Complementary late afternoon snack ( with hot courses) served in the lobby. This is a great feature considering that in the neighborhood where the hotel is located there is not much. Not a restaurant or a conveninece store. The area where the hotel is located seemed kind of run down. The only parking option is the valet which we found overpriced. Professional reception staff. Some rooms have an indoors view on the lobby and the reataurant. If privacy is a priority for you I would make sure not to stay in one of those rooms. Mostly the lower floors rooms once the courtains are opened are like a stage in a theatre. In the hotel there is a small gym with nice machines. I did't use it but I think the access is free.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for Airport if passing through”
Reviews.Author: linda077
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the Embassy Suites on a Saturday night having just flown in, We were planning on sightseeing in Boston on Sunday then picking up hire car to travel to Cape Cod. The Embassy Suites are a short shuttle ride from airport. The rooms are absolutely fine (all hotels rooms seemed expensive in May because of graduations I think). Large rooms, clean, good comfy bed etc. However I would not recommend stopping in for the Manager's complimentary buffet!!
