We did as we were tired from flight but it is only really crisps, nibbles, crudites etc and free non alcoholic beverages. The bar is good. However, the next day we went to the T and travelled into the City. If we had realised how near and easy this was (10 mins - two stops) we would have gone out for dinner. We could have kicked ourselves for missing out on this experience. Breakfast was much better - and included in the price. It is buffet style but has everything you can think of, eggs, bacon, potatoes, etc pastries, pancakes, fruit, etc. The staff were very helpful - we stored our luggage there for the day with no problems. Would recommend this hotel for convenience and location for airport and car hire. By the way it is literally next door to Avis.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel EVER! there a week and saw a lot of bad things!”
Reviews.Author: neid24
Reviews.Content: we stayed for a total of 7 whole days. when we checked in and got to our room we were pleasantly surprised. clean and neat describes our first take. we have stayed at other ESs in the US and were always pleasantly surprised. day two was another story. we left our room daily at 8a, ate breakfast downstairs and took off touring the city! upon return to our room at 7p on day two...we were confronted with half the towels needed, not vacuumed floor, no coffee or amenities, no water, the bed was made half-way. a call to the front desk brought apologies only. nothing more. every day the cleaning became worse and worse! our rug was never vacuumed the entire time we were there. now for the food portion of the stay...whata joke! breakfast: if you are not there when they first open you can forget anything hot or anything half way decent. pastries seemed to someones leftovers! hard and stale tasting. as items would run out (silverware, food, refreshments) you had to actually go to the front desk and talk to someone that spoke English to get any half-decent service. all the attendees in the breakfast area were beyond lazy and not at all helpful. the managers snacks every day at 5p or so: greasy, lukewarm and tasteless. so what if it is free! we are paying decent money for a room and it is the least they can do for the money.....give us good food! once again, if you got there a half hour after it opened good luck getting anything worth eating! complaints to management on four different occasions got NOTHING done. an entire week and NO CLEAN BED SHEETS! that is absurd! two adults in the room and we got two towels and one washcloth daily. the day we checked in there were ample towels (4 bath towels, 4 hand towels, 4 wash cloths, mat for the floor). no explanation was ever given as to why the service was so shoddy. we will never go back to another embassy suites hotel as long as we live NOR would i recommend it to anyone!!! my money would have been better spent at a Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- Best at the airport if you have young kids”
Reviews.Author: strablizky
Reviews.Content: We booked through Priceline and got an amazing deal- Great hotel- friendly staff, clean and comfortable rooms- There were a couple of things that really stood out and made this hotel better than others-1) The breakfast buffet was great and started at 5:30am 2) Nightly manager's reception with snacks (cheese and crackers, crab cakes, chips and salsa, pigs in a blanket) along with any nonalcoholic beverage- I recommend bringing an insulated mug and to fill it before returning to your room so you don't have to buy drinks through the vending machine -I also recommend taking full advantage of the full breakfast and the nightly snacks and just eat a big lunch while in Boston- it saves a lot of $$- 3) There is a GREAT park next to the hotel- it was great for our 4yr old- What a great find at an airport hotel!!! 4) It was a 5 minute walk through the park to the T station- Super easy and fast transprtation into Boston- you did not have to wait for shuttles- The pool was small but nice and had a nice hottub. The rooms were nicely laid out with a pullout sofa in the livingroom area and a little refrigerator and microwave. The beds were super comfortable. It was a less than 5 minute shuttle to the terminals. The only negative was parking was $32 per night (we didn't use it so it wasn't an issue for us) as it is right at the airport- We paid $72 including taxes and fees from Priceline and felt we got a fantastic deal- We used the name your own price feature so we did not know what hotel we were getting but we could not have been more pleased!!! To sum up- This was the best experience we've ever had at an airport hotel- The park next to the hotel along with the breakfast and nightly snacks and how close to the T Station it was sold us!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Defintely recommend”
Reviews.Author: janewdc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Boston for my birthday and stayed at the Embassy Suites. Since our arrival at the airport everything was easy and comfortable. A shuttle picked us up at the airport in five minutes and we were soon at the hotel since it's very very close. For that reason I thought the noise would really bother me but it didn't. It's conveniently located, you just have to cross an athletic field and you're at the T station, or if you prefer the shuttle takes you there too. The room is extremely comfortable, with a living room where you can eat or watch tv and relax, and a separate bedroom to rest very comfortably. The only complain is that the bed wasn't that comfortable for us, very soft, but we're used to sleeping in a very hard mattress so I figure that's the problem. The hotel offers a very varied breakfast buffet, and snacks in the afternoon which we really enjoyed. If we ever go back to Boston, I think we'll choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to something better. We won't go back again”
Reviews.Author: Herbieiii
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on New Year's eve because we had an early flight on New Years day. We haven't stayed here in a while and I thought the hotel showed a bit of wear since we last stayed there. It still was adequate for an overnight. The complimentary reception gathering is horrible. Don't go. The restaurant is average at best but since it is more convenient than going out it serves the purpose. The horror show started after lights out. It was New Years eve and the hotel was hosting a private party in one of the function rooms. The music was so loud coming out of that party we could hear it in our room in the far corner of the hotel on the 4th floor ALL NIGHT LONG! When I went down to the lobby at 4a.m. and stepped out of the elevator the music was so loud I could feel the vibrations from the bass on my skin. We vitually had no sleep. I called and complained to the hotel manager the following week and to the hotel's credit they did refund my money. We will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and not too far from the city”
Reviews.Author: thehazards
Reviews.Content: As airport hotels go this one is quite good esp for the money. A free Embassy Suites bus continuosly circles the airport terminals and hotels. There's nowhere nearby to eat or drink but the basic hotel restaurant in the atrium serves the usual selection of fried foods etc until late and a free all-you-can-eat breakfast. The room was big and comfortable and easily accomodated the 5 of us. The area seemed very safe and we didn't feel threatened walking to the 7 mins to the blue line (Airport stop) subway station: walk straight across from the hotel into the kids playground opposite and the subway staion is in the far left corner of the artifical turf big sports field (10 o'clock direction). it's then only a couple of stops into town and the freedom trail etc.

Reviews.Title: “Why Pay Central Boston Prices!?”
Reviews.Author: Carpe-Dium
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights; the hotel shuttle collected us from the airport which was only a short distance to the hotel. The front desk staff was a little unpleasant and didnâ€™t make us feel hugely welcome, however dealt with our check-in swiftly. Our room was very clean, with a separate lounge area, complete with sofa, arm chair, coffee table, desk, flat screen TV and a wet bar. The bedroom also has a flat screen TV. The bedding was very comfortable. The bathroom was clean and had basic amenities. We had complementary breakfast each day, which consisted of a variety of cereals, fruits, pastries and extensive hot breakfast, including a hot omelette station. The hotel also has a 24 hours swipe card access business centre, with 4 PCs each with Internet access and complimentary use of printers. The hotel operates a shuttle service to the T-Station via the airport; however the station is within 5 minute walk through a well lit park. We walked through the park during the day and night whilst we were in Boston. The train takes approximately 10 minutes into the main town. Overall apart from the unprofessional check in staff, we enjoyed our stay and would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Low expectations, HIGH reward!”
Reviews.Author: stewed31
Reviews.Content: Initially I was just looking for a hotel to stay in and didn't worry too much about what it offered because my focus was touring Boston. When I arrived it turned out to be more than I bargained for. Location - Couldn't beat it for being a reasonably priced hotel close to the airport. The subway was just a short walk away. There was no problem with airport noise at all. Across the street was a small playground and a couple athletic fields which will come in handy when I return with my kids. Service - Very professional and pleasant. Each night I would return and watch the Olympics at the hotel bar. The tender was always friendly, chatty and helped solo business travelers start up conversations. Room was always clean and the breakfast was outstanding. If you pay more you can be in the city closer to a subway stop but for a discount, a little walking this hotel fit my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Logan Airport, Large Suites, Comfy Beds, Good Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: PoblanoJ
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a number of Logan Airport hotels. This was my first time at the Embassy Suites. Their airport shuttle is efficient and if all you want to do is sleep before or after a flight, this hotel serves the purpose well. Comfortable beds, complimentary extensive breakfast buffet. As in all Embassy Suites hotels, the rooms are all large suites with kitchens -- something kind of unusual and hard to understand the need for in an airport sleep factory, far from food stores... if you are looking for a longer-term stay in Boston, there are certainly many more convenient hotels than this one. The next time I'm reserving a hotel near Logan I'm going to go back to the Hampton Inn (also a Hilton property). It's usually less expensive, the beds are just as comfortable, it's just as clean and inviting, and the service seems a little more personal (but the breakfast buffet isn't as grand and the location is another 3-4 minutes away from the terminals).

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: FrqTravlr
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel with airport transportation and easy access to the freeways. This hotel was the cheapest among the quality airport hotels. If all you want is a bed, there are some others that will be cheaper. The airport pick up was great and they had a fantastic spread at the managers reception. Breakfast was equally impressive. I took the subway downtown for dinner. The subway stop was a quick walk through a park across the street from the hotel. There isn't anything around the hotel so you either take the subway into Boston or you don't leave the hotel. The room was very spacious and well lit. The only thing that really bothered me was the $9.95 charge for internet access. I can't stand hotels that charge for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “ok location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: fdawgvt
Reviews.Content: We went for a weekend in October and found this to be the most reasonably priced hotel in the area. It was about a 5 min walk from the T (AIrport stop on the blue line), which provided us access to pretty much everywhere we want to go. There was a mix up about our room where they gave us one king instead of two queens. The bellman though came up to our floor and showed us to our new room. The hotel shuttle and prompt and helpful service to and from the airport. The front desk was not very helpful with getting around the city or pointing out some of the sights. Luckily we did our own research and new where to go. Breakfast in the morning was great and was always a pleasant start to our day.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Airport and T to get into Boston”
Reviews.Author: tripazoid
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 4 nights. It did not seem very busy so that was nice and eliminated alot of typical hotel noise. I was delighted to find how easy it was to get into Boston on the T. I bought a pass in the machine and just used that everyday. Could either ride the hotel shuttle or walk thru park to get to the station. It was very easy. Room was clean/not immaculate but clean. I liked the room lay out and the flat screen tv screens. The hotel halls were not always spiffy usually a bit of paper on the floor or dishes from room service. I really liked the washer dryer down the hall that was very convenient. I ate at the hotel for the breakfast and the managers reception. The food was ok. not outstanding, very average but very convenient to just run downstairs for breakfast without much effort before sightseeing and upon returning to have a bite to eat. traveled alone - it served my purpose and I enjoyed my stay. I did not have to pay over $200.00 night that actually was why I stayed here initially and not downtown this trip.. I found the hotel staff friendly and helpful. I will consider a hotel downtown next trip but I would consider staying here again if I wanted to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Not a typical Embassy - dirty, icky, sticky, gross”
Reviews.Author: Bexthreekids
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on the night before we had to fly out of Boston because of the convenience. Sadly, it was not the best Embassy we've stayed at. The property was in the midst of a remodeling during our stay, as signs throughout the building apologized and thanked us for our understanding. We didn't notice any real "remodeling," and wondered if the signs were just an excuse for the general lack of cleanliness we experienced. The hallways were in need of vacuuming, and the elevators were full of crumbs and in need of vacuuming, as well. We arrived at our room after being greeted at the front desk by a pleasant, if not especially personable, clerk, to find that it was unacceptably dirty and smelled strongly of cigarette smoke, despite the "no smoking" sign on the door. There were stains on the carpet, hair in the shower, an apparently uncleaned toilet, and cluttered with miscellaneous furniture. My husband returmed to the front desk to request a different room and was told that all that was available was a handicapped suite. We decided to take our chances and found the new room to be much more acceptable. Being handicapped-accessible, it was free of the extraneous desk and there was much more room to move around. Additionally, the bathroom was great - big and roomy, although with a standard bathtub (not a roll-in type), I don't know how truly "handicap accessible" it would have been. This room was slightly cleaner, but at least didn't reek of cigarette smoke. When we got up the next morning and returned to the main lobby for breakfast, we noted the stickiness of the floors around the food area (which had been there the previous night), and were a little reluctant to eat there because of the general filthiness of the place. The next time we stay in Boston, we'll definitely bypass this unfortunate Embassy. Not at all what we've come to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Boston Logan Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: mykidsdadRedlands
Reviews.Content: I took my boys on a week trip to New York, Boston, Chicago and Detroit to catch the Mets, Yankees (twice), Red Sox, Cubs and Tigers. This meant several days in a row of up at 5am to shuttles by 6am and many planes and trains and flights city to city. I believe of all of out stops, we enjoyed the Embassy Suites Boston Logan the most. it was conveniently near the airport and a short walk to the subway station. The room was ready early and was clean with a great view of the Boston skyline. The only inconveniences were that breakfast starts later on Saturdays, so being up and ready to leave at 6am meant we had to eat breakfast at the airport. Also, the city of Boston does not allow complimentary cocktails, so no free happy hour. However, we did have a very enjoyable time at the Embassy Suites and in Boston and will probably return next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Boston”
Reviews.Author: Lucyep
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here at the beginning and end of our trip to Boston and Cape Cod. I was worried about staying near the airport but it was all so easy, we called for a shuttle to come and get us and that arrived within about 20 minutes, the driver pointed out the Metro station to us and told us how to get there on foot but also said we could get the shuttle to take us too. The Metro is about a 10 minute stroll away and is brilliant for getting into the centre of Boston - trust me you don't want to drive! I would recommend not walking back through the park at night on your own though as that might be a little scary. The hotel is mixed with tourists and business people. It's clean, comfortable and everything you would expect from an Embassy Suites. Perfect location, good breakfast, very friendly staff and a great shuttle service. Oh also just round the corner from car hire places which was handy to pick up and return our Avis car. We did get a really good rate which was the main reason we stayed there but we will definitely stay there again when we next go to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: Cheesehead88
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights on a trip with friends to Boston. I was a little concerned with the location begin so close to the airport but it actually turned out to be a bonus. And I never heard any airport associated noise at all. Check in was smooth and the room was fantastic. Nice two room suite with two flatscreen tv's. Room was clean and nicely stocked. It included a refridgerator and a microwave. Got in late the first night and ordered room service. Food was good, albiet a bit pricey. Hotel is just a short walk through a nice park from the T station. From there you can be anywhere in the city in a matter of minutes. My friends were looking for some help in finding a place to purchase a baby stroller and the staff could not have been more helpful. The Breakfast was excellent each morning and far more than the usual hotel free breakfast. They also offer a nice pool and spa with a seperate exercise facility. I have stayed in many many hotels in Boston and this is by far the best value for the money. Highly recommend and will stay there again when I go back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was just right”
Reviews.Author: SaltLakeCityStuart
Reviews.Content: This hotel far surpassed my expectations. The room was comfortable and quiet. The staff is extremely friendly. The shuttle was available for the airport, "T" station, etc, and the drivers were professional and courteous. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What???.... no cocktails!!!!”
Reviews.Author: one_lucky_guy-21
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here while attending a convention in Boston. This is not the best Embassy I ever stayed at. As a Hilton Honors Gold member, I expected a little better treatment. The women at the front desk was rather rude and let me know that my room was not ready when I checked in. I did try to check in around noon time instead of the 3 pm time listed by the hotel. I can accept that the room was not ready but the attitude of the front desk was not professional. I also thought they would have given me a better room than the 5th floor since I requested a high floor room. The hotel has 10 floors and only has a coulple of good directions to look out at. The park accross the street is actually a better view to get. Now for the 2 perks that Embassy offers.... a suite with a pull out sofa, microwave, a small refrigerator, and a nice bathroom that was accessable from both the bedroom and "living room". These were good.. The other perk... breakfast and a 2 hour "managers reception" (which usually means cocktails/beer/wine and some food was a huge disappointment. The breakfast was OK... it depends if they had what you were looking for when you got there. They ran out of bacon, coffee, cups, and glasses several times while I was down for breakfast. I don't know if the bus people were on strike but it looked like managers were picking up plates and clearing tables. They did not seem to like what they were doing and were rude to many. If it was the regular work staff.... then they need an attitude adjustment. But let me warn those who look forward to the "free" booze at the Embassy.... you won't get any here. It is a State law that does not allow anyone or any business to give away free drinks. Heck... they don't even have "happy hour" in Massachusetts because you can't sell liquor at a discount either. Dumb!!! I did like the proximity of the hotel to the T (subway). I never tried to catch a shuttle... it's only a 10 minute walk and it is a nice park to walk through. From there you could be in downtown in 8-10 minutes. Overall.... this was a big disappointment and rates about where it is in comparison to the other Boston hotels. (around #38 for Trip Advisor). The suites might be good for families and since our convention had shuttles to the convention center, I did not have to worry about transportation into the city. Stay here if you have a short layover and need a place near the airport. Otherwise... go into the downtown or Commans area and stay there.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location, staff needs attitude adjustment”
Reviews.Author: mom808
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this airport hotel both our first arrival night and ten days later for the return flight home. The plus: very convenient to the airport and subway. The shuttle picked us up but the driver seemed way to grumpy to either help with our luggage (we were traveling with my 6 year old and two grandmothers in their mid-seventies) and didn't even bother with a "hello". We live in Hawaii and take several mini vacations so we always tip. I would have hesitated but my husband did tip him anyway...all he did was nod as he pocketed the money. We were the only ones who tipped the driver! Check in was okay but again the lack of friendly service was obvious. The rooms were clean and we did not hear any airport noise. A lot of noise came through the walls and from the hall. You can hear the water running from the next room. The morning breakfast was very good. The nightly manager's reception is not food to feed children or elderly. Make sure you arrange to eat out! They did offer restraunt service but we ate elsewhere...Legal Seafood is only 2 subway stops (aquarium) from the hotel and was very good. Both stays were similar so it may be better to stay elsewhere if you are looking for a more friendly or caring staff. (one exception was during breakfast, a very pleasant gentleman who appeared to be the manager came around and asked if we were enjoying our breakfast...this was the only time we felt any hospitality) We live in Hawaii and hope Embassy Suites try harder to convey a little "aloha" to their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Dennywms
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. My wife and I were in Boston on vacation and this location made it perfect for daily sightseeing trips into town. The Airport T station is in easy walking distance thru a very nice, well-lit park. After a week stay, I was able to walk to Avis and pick up our rental car for a trip around New England. A week later I returned the car to Avis and walked back to spend our last night in town back at the Embassy. The next morning the very friendly shuttle driver took us to the airport. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The free breakfast each morning has a good selection to please just about anyone. You do not hear the airport at all! very quiet rooms, especially since they are suites and you can close off the bedroom doors to block noise from the hallway. We only tried the restaurant food once, the food was very good, but the wait staff were somewhat slow, I suspect that with the free breakfast and the nightly Manager's reception, they are used to people helping themselves. Although it didnt matter to us, the pool is open but still undergoing renovation and the fitness center is not open. The kiosk in the lobby for printing borading passes was out of order, but I was able to print them in the Business Center with no problems. There is wireless internet available in the rooms for $9.95 for 24hrs. This would be one of my few complaints, as all cheaper hotels such as Holiday Inn Express or Best Western do not charge for internet. Overall we had a very good experience at this hotel and would recommend it to anyone travelling business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant”
Reviews.Author: leylamaria
Reviews.Content: what a great place this is. the staff were the best and most helpful i have ever experienced. would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jaklyn69
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful! Hotel was very clean and service was great. We didnâ€™t spend much time at the pool as we out enjoying the sites! The breakfast was great and extremely convenient for my family traveling with very small children. Those little bellies are hungry quite early!! The suite was comparable to many we have stayed at- and with a large family (more than two children) a suite is essential. Necessities like bottles and snacks all you moms know the drill!! Canâ€™t comment about the fitness room either again just too busy enjoying my quality time with family. Our daily routine is fitness enough!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport & T (transit) but mediocre hotel & services”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust_Bee
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was terrible; they were out of most everything including plates. The room was okay but no attention to details missing washcloths, tea bag, shampoo.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was just OK.”
Reviews.Author: nicoleof2
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at our hotel room we where greeted by dirty dishes at the entry way. Not a good sign. The bathroom needed more attention as was evident with hair in the shower and urine on the toilets pedastal. Otherwise, the rest of the room was ok. The pool was small and heavily chlorinated - bring goggles. The jacuzzi fit maybe 6 adults? Just ok. The gym left me unmotivated to work out and I normally work out 5 days a week/2 hours each day. The breakfast hours are ridiculous - Come on!! 9am!! We're on vacation - who wants to get up and have to rush to get down there. My advice - early bird get the worm!! And bring it back to the room for the rest of us....Thanks husband of mine!! The airconditioner is very noisy when it comes on - in fact so much so it would wake our 1 year old every 15 minutes or so. He got use to it after the first night - probably because he just so darn exhausted. As for the staff - great job - very attentive to our needs. In fact we lost our cold water and maintenance had us up and running in less than 30 minutes!! The view from our room 1027 was awesome!! Apparantley there is only 4 rooms with such views. The park is right outside the hotel - very conveniant when you have small children, and the "T" (subway) is just beyond the park - perfect location...Request the 10th floor and bring some disinfectant wipes and you're stay will go from ok to average!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: ccgreer
Reviews.Content: New hotel with convenient location @ Logan (although they charge $32/day for parking). No noise from the airport which was very surprising. The 'T' (Blue line subway) is a very short walk across the street. We had a Suite with a kitchenette, 2 TV's, 2 Queen size beds and a pull-out couch, the entire layout was kinda small but if you're only staying for somewhere to sleep and most of your time will be in the city it's fine. Found the Pool to be very small and only 3 1/2 ft at deepest point (it was good for the 6 yr old), Hot tub was out of order. Complementary breakfast looked great but we missed it because it ended at 9 AM, too early after a night in the big city. There's a great, brand-new park with a playground directly across from the front entrance with new soccer and baseball fields, also a new paved walking path (the 12 year old was bummed he didn't bring his skateboard). Overall it was very clean and we would recommend it compared with paying the $300-$400+ rates in the heart of Boston (AAA rate was around $200 for a Suite).

Reviews.Title: “Everything costs a little extra in Beantown, I suppose”
Reviews.Author: bkafrick
Reviews.Content: Room was clean. Location was about 5 seconds from the airport, and it also has a T (subway) stop about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Downsides: Internet is not included (approx $10 a day), and the only parking is valet ($20 a night). Just seems that you get nickle and dimed to death these days, but I guess thats hotels in a big city. Breakfast was decent, and maybe a little better than your average Embassy Suites breakfast. Overall a good hotel that likes to charge you for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable hotel, is this an atrium-style Embassy?”
Reviews.Author: purpleknif67
Reviews.Content: Compared with other Embassy Suites I have stayed in, this one was far smaller than the ones I have stayed in in Chicago, Cleveland and Pittsburgh. But as I've said in earlier posts, if you're staying in Boston, that's the way it is. The hotel, however, appears to be fairly new, very clean and in good to excellent condition--not "worn-out" or banged up like some Embassies I have stayed in. The bed had numerous fluffy pillows and the alarm clock is quite handy and easy to use. The bed seemed a bit lumpy but there might have been a pillow top on it. Still, I got a good night's sleep and I was surprised that being so close to the airport, it was fairly quiet. The mini fridge and sink, found in most Embassy Suites is always a nice addition. Unlike the other three Embassy Suites I have stayed in, the hallways at this Embassy Suites are not "open" in does not overlook an atrium. Being a solo female traveler, this is one of the main reasons I stay at the Embassy Suites and I was concerned that this safety feature was not part of the hotel. I have some concerns about customer service and I hope in time some will be corrected. After picking up my baggage, I called the hotel to ask for a van pick-up. I asked the operator where to wait. I travel to Boston irregularly and sometimes I forget where I have to go for van pick-up. I want to make sure I'm going to the right place. Hotel employees should remember that travelers don't always know where to go--that is why they are contacting the front desk. I'm wondering if the majority of the guests who stay here are business guests or airline crew who stay at the hotel often and "know the ropes." Her reply was rather rude and abrupt--I was asking a question, in a neutral tone--I wasn't yelling at her. The van driver, on the other hand, was very kind, helpful and accommodating. I am awaiting a phone call from lost and found about an item I left in my room--this is my second phone call and both calls have been directed to voice mail.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Darn Nice!”
Reviews.Author: DCvagabond1
Reviews.Content: First of all, I am a huge fan of Embassy Suites when I am travelling on business. I like the fact that you have two rooms, a microwave, a little fridge, and free breakfast. I don't expect charm, but what's charming about a business trip? To my way of thinking, this is an especially nice Embassy Suites. I arrived at about ten o'clock on a freezing cold, snowy night since the United flight was two hours late (shocker!). Yes, the lobby is cavernous and barn-like, but the room was nicely and cheerily decorated, with five fluffy pillows on the bed, a yellow velvet duvet and yellow velvet bolster pillow. Everything appeared to be brand new. The room was very quiet (amazing for an airport hotel) and the sheets were nice and soft and didn't feel as if they had been washed a million times. Breakfast is available beginning at 5:30 a.m. so you can zip down and get a cup of coffee as soon as you get up. And the breakfast looked pretty good. Boston hotels are astronomically expensive these days, so to find a comfortable place to stay for way less than $200, and only a 15 minute cab-ride from downtown is pretty nice!

Reviews.Title: “We felt really taken care of”
Reviews.Author: leafpeeper98
Reviews.Content: We reviewed a few different hotels that offered a park and fly package. I think we paid $175 for one night accomodation and one week car park. The hotel room was beautiful with a big spacious bath and a seperate living room in addition to a bedroom. What really impressed us where the employees. When I pulled up a "valet" was right there to greet me, take the car away and help me with the bags to my room. He refused a tip and said that he was actually a hotel engineer who didn't want me to have to wait because the actual valet was busy! Check in was flawless. I was taken right away by shuttle to the airport stop on the blue line. I could not believe my ears when the driver took a call from his boss that I overheard. The boss told the driver how much he appreciated him, and the driver told the boss that he had made his day and he loved working there. My husband used a pay phone to call for the shuttle from the Airport subway stop and was astonished when the shuttle showed up in about 3 minutes (this is really nice on a cold winter evening). Their shuttle runs every 15 minutes 24/7 to all the terminals and was right there on time at 4:15 AM when we needed it. We were told that the staff will give you a to go bag of a muffin and apple if you depart before the restaurant opens at 6 AM. When we returned we called for the shuttle which arrived very quickly and they had our car ready and waiting with the heater running at the front door (again very appreciated on winter morning). When I went to tip the valet for handling the bags and bringing up the car, he had vanished. Also the shuttle driver went out of his way to make sure that we understood how to navigate the airport exits on the way out of the hotel. Could all of this "niceness" really be happening at a big city hotel? It is hard to believe, but they must be serving happy pills in the employee cafeteria! I am still amazed a level of solicitude and just plain friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. I do agree with the earlier poster that this is an airport hotel and would not be convenient for anyone who is attending a convention or needed to be downtown for appointments. Try to request a city view room on a high floor, alas we did not get one and our view was of acres of parked cars and car rental shops.

Reviews.Title: “What convenience”
Reviews.Author: Traveller2336
Reviews.Content: The staff was so pleasant and helpful. We booked this because we had an early flight the following morning. It was so convenient. We ate dinner at the hotel on the night of feb. 17, 2008 and the waiter was so helpful(I am pregnant so I had to ask him about ingedients in a few of the dishes). Then we stored our car their for the week we were away. They picked my husband up promptly at the airport upon our return. We will definitely stay here on future early morning flights.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but a little far from the main attractions in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Dover314
Reviews.Content: Let's just say I was not impressed for the price I paid. I stayed here on business for three nights and was happy to leave. The hotel is close to the airport and the complimentary breakfast was good but that's the only nice thing I have to say. The room was somewhat clean, the tub and shower could have used some work. The sofabed was horrible. The sheets were clean but had multiple holes in them. My main complaint however was the location. Since Boston has a very slow public transportation system compared to many other major cities it took forever to get anywhere. One day it took and entire hour to get to the Seaport/Financial district. My recommendation is, for the price they charge, stay somewhere more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “New Embassy Suites Only”
Reviews.Author: AngelMel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Embassy Suites Logan Airport during the World Series this year...where the Red Sox started their sweep. Anyhow, I was dreading staying at this hotel a) because the location to Fenway was absolutely inconvenient, and b) most of my experiences at the Embassy Suites have been extremely disappointing. However, I must say, if you are staying at the airport, this is an excellent option. It is very obviously a newer Embassy Suites because it is not pink, and the decor is more modern. We had plenty of room with a sitting area, large table/desk, and large bedroom, though the layout was somewhat cramped in the bedroom...it really didn't matter, I am just giving detail. The beds were extremely comfortable, the room was clean, and I even enjoyed the products in the restroom. The washer/dryer located on the 4th...I believe...floor proved to be useful during my 3-night stay. The mini mart downstairs sold detergent, fabric softener, and other items. I ordered room service and had a delicious club sandwich and french fries. The fitness center is small, and the treadmills are noisy, but they get the job done and there is also an indoor pool. Overall, I would say this was a great option and I would recommend it to any business traveler. Finally - the valets were very friendly as well as the young lady working the front desk. The warm cookies at the front are a must-try.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Gordon2112
Reviews.Content: Due to the high prices of hotels in downtown boston we decided to opt for the Embassy Suites at the airport. I don't normally make a habit of choosing airport hotels, but this place was a revelation. We loved our suite as soon as the door opened and were immediately impressed with the standard and comfort of the accommodation. As others have noted, the hotel is conveniently located for both the T and the majority of the car hire companies. We had booked a car through Avis, which I simply picked up on the morning of departure by walking across the street - couldn't have been simpler. The breakfast every morning was great, very comfortable surroundingls and great service. I will definitely go out of my way to stay in another Embassy Suites based on this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: KYP2007
Reviews.Content: Of the three hotels in fairly close proximity to the Logan Airport, we chose to stay in this one because it was cheaper than the Hilton and it was close to the car rental. Our stay exceeded my expectations. We stayed on the 10th floor with an excellent view of Boston. Hertz is right across the road from the hotel, so it was just a short walk after dropping off our rental car. Best of all, the walk to the T from the hotel was really lovely as it winds through a playground and a soccer field. In fact, my daughter spent an hour playing in the playground on the way back to the hotel (after a couple of hours in Boston). The room is excellent. We loved that there is a bedroom and a lounge room and there is a TV in each of the two rooms. The bathroom is big, in working order and spotless. While this hotel is situated close to the airport, we didn't hear any planes taking off or landing. It was just so quiet. The staff there are also very friendly. During breakfast, one of the hotel staff offered my daughter chocolates as it was Halloween. The valet parking staff is also helpful. The hotel also provided shuttle to the airport and that worked without any problems. There is not much in the way of restaurants in the area, but one of the reception staff (can't remember his name, but we really appreciated how helpful he was to all the questions we had) suggested a pizza place a quarter of a mile from the hotel, which was quite good. I would definitely stay here again if I we go back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect--except mabye the living room...”
Reviews.Author: lebelgo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before a little foliage tour starting from Boston. We didn't stay here when we came back, because, probably due to the AL championship series (Red Sox) which was going on then, the price more than doubled. I'm basing my review on the price we paid--that is, $160. I have also stayed three times at the Hilton-Logan (two for extended stays) and at the Hampton Inn-Logan for a four night stay, so I can compare these three HHonors properties. To be brief, the Hilton gets the edge over this hotel only with respect to its fitness facilities. The only improvement the Hampton has over this facility is that its parking is free (and easy). While all three made for a comfortable, pleasant stay, I would prefer to stay in this hotel if the prices are similar (big if--it really depends on expected occupancy!). (1) Roominess. As one might expect from an Embassy Suites, the rooms have more space. I will have to qualify this by saying that the living room was a bit smaller than that of any other Embassy Suites I've stayed at, however. This hotel is the only one of the three with two TV's, a full-sized couch, and a full-sized dining room table in addition to the coffee table. And it's the only one with a microwave oven and full sink. (2) Easy access to the T, and the only one of the three which does not require a shuttle. You're just a few stops from downtown. What could be easier? (3) Easy access to rental car lots. Again, the only one which doesn't require a shuttle (across the street from Dollar, Hertz, and Avis lots)--although the others will send their shuttles (4) Best breakfast, hands-down. The Hilton has an expanded Continental breakfast on its top floor for us HHonors Gold members, and, as usual, the Hampton two hot food offerings. Embassy Suites are known for their breakfasts and evening receptions, however. (5) Best dinner. We ordered room service at the Embassy Suites, having arrived after 10 PM. Our dishes were delicious (I had the seafood pasta)--even better than the better of the two Hilton eateries. (6) The Hilton and the Embassy Suites tie for their excellent shuttle service--rarely more than a 5 minute wait for either (they are both so close to the terminal). (7) The views are a virtual tie for the Hilton and the Embassy Suites--assuming you get a room with a city view. The Hilton does have a nicer gym in that it has a changing/locker room (I 'm never thrilled about going in the elevator in sweaty gym attire), as well as a sauna/spa. Also, if you have a car, the Hampton Inn will be more convenient--just park in and leave when you want for free. I loved our all-too-brief time at this Embassy Suites. I'll definitely look into staying here the next time I come to Boston--assuming I can't get something cheap on Priceline, and assuming the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Decent Price, Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jake427
Reviews.Content: Chose this property after researching hotel prices in Boston. Property fit our needs as it was the best value of the hotels in this class in our desired location. We stayed 3 nights with an early morning flight out. Shuttle was very convenient and ran at all hours. There is a T stop a short walk from the hotel that takes one directly into the city making the city very managable with little effort. The shuttle dropped us off and picked us up at the T the first day. However, once we saw how close the stop was to the hotel we simply took the short stroll through the park to the T. The rooms were spacious and clean. There was a nice big bathroom and a small fridge and microwave. Lobby includes a restaurant and bar. We only used the restaurant at breakfast time. Room rate includes a breakfast. Breakfast was pretty good with an omlette station, pancakes, waffles, fruit and the usual assortment of donuts and carb fare. The first night we stayed in and ordered room service. Room service was pricey as it typically is in hotels, but the food was decent and it didn't take long to get. The one downside of this property is that it isn't close to any restaurants. If one desires non hotel food then a trip on the T into the city is the way to go. One reason we chose this hotel other than the fact it was close to the airport, but it also close to rental car agencies. We flew into Boston, rented a car and drove into Maine for a few nights, then returned to Boston, dropped off the car at Budget, walked to the hotel and used the T the rest of the time. All in all the stay was good and I would likely stay here again. I would prefer a hotel in the city, but the prices were a bit steep for the extra convenience. Plus, this hotel was quiet despite being close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good Property”
Reviews.Author: bdw1989
Reviews.Content: I was provided a generous gift basket upon arrival in honor of my 20th anniversary. I was amazed at how the property also upgraded us to their Presidential Suite. I was a little weary of staying at the airport, but I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad at all”
Reviews.Author: sksimon
Reviews.Content: We decided on the Embassy Suites at Logan for a short Honeymoon and at the time found the "city" hotels a bit pricey. The first and best thing I can say about this hotel is the service and kindness of its employees. They were wonderful and always helpful and smiling. The room was fine - a nice suite that was quiet considering that we were facing the airport. The small things that were noticable was that in our room the fan in the bathroom didn't work, there were 2 lights in the room that had no lightbulbs in them, and the bed was a bit uncomfortable - oh, and during our stay we had unseasonably hot weather (80's and humid - in October!) and the air conditioning just couldn't keep up, so at night it was stuffy in the bedroom. The T station was a 5 to 10 minute walk through the park and even at night, we felt safe. The Boston PD seemed to always have watch over the park which was great. In all, I would stay here again, but if we could get a place intown - I would rather do that than keep taking the T or a cab in and out of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad”
Reviews.Author: jimbuddi
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Diamond member I typically get upgraded to a better room, which I did in this case. I had Suite 1020 which is a bit larger then the normal suites but only because they have an 8 person conference table in the extra space. House keeping was great, even leaving 2 bottles of water each day. Embassy Suites is of course known for their complimentary manager receptions each night. Massachusetts law however prohibits the free booze, so don't expect it, and the one draft Guinness beer that I bought at their bar was almost $7.00, and the food at the reception was the same every night, deep fried cheese sticks and deep fried raviolis. I did find a liquor store about a 10 minute walk from the hotel where I bought a case of beer for my 8 day stay, and there was a fridge in my room. The bartender tried to tell me that it was illegal to bring beer downstairs, but I really think that he was just upset that I bucked the system. The pool is inside and although I didn't use it, it just seemed like a typical indoor pool, and the workout room was smallish. To get into the city you have several different options. You can take a taxi which will cost you between $25.00 and $30.00 for the 2 to 3 mile ride, or take the hotel shuttle to the airport and catch the Silver Line bus from any terminal, for $2.00 each ride. I bought a week long pass that was only $15.00 and was good on both the bus and the Subway, which they call the "T". I bought this pass just inside the baggage claim door at the airport. The Blue Line "T" is a 5 minute walk through the park across the street, and takes you right into the main tourist part of Boston, get off at State. The State station is right in the middle of the Freedom trail, so you can take it to the left or right. There is one place that I have to recommend to eat, and it has nothing to do with Boston and seafood. I was actually going into town for seafood and ran across a place that is only in Europe and I eat at frequently in Amsterdam. Is a noodle shop called Wagamama, and they have 2 locations in Boston, which are the only 2 in the U.S. It is in the Faneuil Hall Marketplace. Please give it a try. Back to the hotel. The service could have been better, and not that you need to be waited on hand and foot but the reception was less then friendly. There were plenty of people at the desk, but no one stood out as friendly, and remember I was there 9 days, so occasionally I had to stop by the desk to ask a question. I am just saying that a little more effort could be put into customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Substance over Style - the Place to Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Carlynn
Reviews.Content: Whatever wear-n-tear in the decor was more than made up for by the first-class attention from staff members. Everyone we came in contact with treated us as if we were their only guests. In fact, the graciousness seemed so unusual, I thought they might have confused us with home-office executives doing a surprise inspection. If we had been, they would have passed the performance review and received an A for cleanliness. The person in charge of maintenance made himself visible and available. The concierge was an ace in multi-tasking. Desk personnel were always out front and ready with answers and assistance. Even the dining room managers made their presence known at all meal times. Housekeeping never invaded our privacy or took over the halls in the morning. While the design of the hotel is a little different than most Embassy Suites, it appears it was necessary to soundproof the rooms from the airport noise. It didn't take anything away from the experience, which was a week's stay in easy comfort, with shuttles running continuously to transportation centers and the weeknight bartender sharing his wealth of Boston knowledge. These were our "hosts", from the first greeting and early accommodation at the desk to the efficient checkout and extended luggage storage, not to mention the shuttle driver's help with our bags at the airport. This is definitely an "extra mile" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel41
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews for this hotel before writing my review, and I must say that the experiences of people who stayed here in July were completely opposite to mine. Maybe the management changed in the meantime, but I thought the staff were all very friendly and helpful. The shuttle bus came to the airport very quickly and the drivers were wonderful. I arrived at the hotel early and left my bags with the valet. They locked them up, there was no waiting, and when I came back to pick them up, again there was someone right there to help. The hotel was fully booked, but I never had to wait for any services. The room was big, comfortable, and clean. Plenty of towels, and the linens on the bed were so much better than at some higher priced hotels where I've stayed. Room service (dinner) arrived in 20 minutes and the food was excellent. The free breakfast, with made-to-order omelets (which I had...delicious) or buffet of scrambled eggs, potatoes, bacon, sausage, etc, fruit, toast, bagels, muffins, and drinks was also excellent. You could also order eggs any way you would like. And don't forget the pancakes! My room overlooked the car rental lot and the airport, but you'd never know it because it was so quiet. I thought all in all it was a great value for the money. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet hotel with excellent suites a stone's throw from the airport”
Reviews.Author: Traveller118
Reviews.Content: If you need to be close to the airport for an early start, especially if you have young children, then this hotel is for you, They run a free and frequent shuttle bus to the terminals and the nearest 'T'. Very quiet two room suites with lots of space. friendly staff and a buffet breakfast is included.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: restes
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 6 night stay at this hotel. This is not a luxury hotel and there were a couple of things that needed updating (shabby linens) but overall we were extremely satisfied with our stay. The suite was large, comfortable and very quiet, in spite of proximity to the airport. Housekeeping was excellent and the included breakfast was certainly worth getting up for. My son and I loved the made to order pancakes (blueberry, raspberry, chocolate chip or strawberry). The walk to the nearest T station was pleasant and made the short trip into Boston a breeze. We really enjoyed coming back (home) after a busy day in Boston and the contrasting quiet was very nice. Staff was very friendly and shuttles to the airport or T station were always available. What's not to like? We would stay there again in a hearbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay! Very nice, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ericsrx
Reviews.Content: Dated hotel. Rooms were clean. Employees were GREAT. Food was really good too. Ended up changing to Embassy Suites from Marriott that I was unhappy with. It was a great change. Hotel is older and is in a poorer part of town. Shuttle service was GREAT. Hotel employees were GREAT. I'd stay there again. I was pleased. Note: Not 5 star. Quiet, comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: patriotconan
Reviews.Content: Very high value place to stay. For approx. $200 we had a room that had a bedroom separate from the "living room." If you have young children or just like to have space, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: beernutz
Reviews.Content: Ironically, I am writing this review from the Business Center of the Embassy Suites Boston Logan--the hotel I am reviewing. I want to say up front that my review is *relative* to the many other Embassy Suites I have previously stayed in. My wife is HHonors Gold status and we stay in many Hilton properties including Embassy Suites. The negative review I am about to give is the result of the fact that this Embassy Suites is extremely run-down looking compared to all other Embassy Suites in which I've stayed and the staff is much more clueless than those encountered at other Embassy Suites properties. I don't know the history of this property but I suspect it has been converted (poorly in my opinion) from a different hotel chain. The staff here, with the exception of the shuttle driver who picked us up promptly from the airport, has been nearly clueless. We arrived at 1:30 to check in and, as we expected, our room was not yet ready. No problem, as we wanted to get some lunch anyway, so we asked about having them hold our luggage. "No problem," I was told and "Please go wait over there by the concierge desk". So we wait, and wait, and wait, all the time in the full view of the front desk and the lady there who had told us where to wait. After about 10 minutes I go back over and ask if we are going to be able to check out bags some time today (actually I asked very nicely), and she acts very surprised that we were still waiting. Hey lady, we've been standing right in your full view while you weren't doing anything for 10 minutes--why would you be surprised? So we finally get someone to help us check our luggage and I then I go back to the front desk lady and ask her for directions to some nearby food and she recommends we walk down Cottage St. to Chelsea where there is a very good pizza place. Great. However after walking probably 3/4 miles (with a 9 and 13 year old) all the way to the end of Cottage we find it never intersects with Chelsea and that you have to walk over a few blocks. Gee thanks for the great directions lady. Strike number two. As an aside, we never did find the place but we did find a nice little sandwich and ice cream shop in the area that I highly recommend--sorry can't remember the name, you'll have to ask the front desk ;-). When we get back to the hotel we find our room is now ready and we check in. When we then ask for our luggage, you'll never guess, we again have to wait standing in front of the desk and have to again ask them for help. Strike three. While we're waiting for our luggage we notice that, hey, isn't that all of our luggage sitting completely unprotected in a small alcove next to the desk with no one around? Why yes it is. Next batter, strike one. It was somewhat amusing when the guy came to give us our luggage (a different person from the one who took it) that HE started to look for it in the locked room next to the desk and WE had to tell him, no, its right there in plain view. Even he look surprised. So now we go up to the room and I have to say again, what a disappointment compared to the other Embassy Suites I've stayed in. And this hotel is not some cheapo hotel either. If I was paying $100 a night, yeah, I'd expect the room to look as tired as it did but not for over $240 a night. Second batter, strike two. Honestly, at the rate this hotel is going in the short time we've been here I think I could strike out the side. I should add like others have done that the nightly managers reception is dry due to local laws. I had read Tripadvisor and knew that however so I wasn't surprised. What has surprised me though is the nearly uniform ineptitude of the staff we have encounted and the somewhat rundown condition of the facilties. I am not a complainer by nature and have always had great experiences at Embassy Suites, so I think the difference from what I've come to expect from this chain is prompting me to write this review as I did as much as the poor experience I have had here. So, even though we are supposed to leave for three days in Maine then come back for three days and stay and this same Embassy Suites, we are cancelling and looking for a better option. Even though this is probably the most convenient place for us to stay there is no way I'm paying to stay here for three nights. I am sure I will stay at other Embassy Suites in the future, however, I am equally sure that I will never stay in this particular one again.

Reviews.Title: “worst embassy suite ever”
Reviews.Author: travelhappySeattle
Reviews.Content: Staff knew nothing about Boston, public transportation, location Brandeiss and no one would help Air conditioning did not work Asked for non smoking and put in a "non smoking room" but could still smell smoke on floor and in room, could not get room switched 2 lamps broken breakfast disorganized, dirty silverware, out of juice driveway cannot accomodate van

Reviews.Title: “decent experience but not typical Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: lisat1
Reviews.Content: Overall it was a good stay although we were only there for one night. I would probably stay there again, although there were a few things I didn't like about it. It wasn't as nice as other Embassy Suites we've stayed at. The breakfast buffet was very disorganized. I had to ask for knives since they ran out and they ran out of Jam and had to ask two people to get some. There was only one toaster for a lot of people to share. The pillows were too poofy and I thought the shower spray was a little wimpy. Also, the subway stop was a little further away than I was expecting. They do have a shuttle although we prefer to walk, which was fine during the day. I would estimate that it's about 4-5 blocks away. At night we didn't feel comfortable walking through the park to get back to the hotel so we took a shuttle. As is typical for an ambassy suites, the room had a seperate bedroom and I did like that the bathroom sink was outside of the bedroom door so you wouldn't wake someone up if using the sink.

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical Embassy Suite”
Reviews.Author: ABBYMAC
Reviews.Content: Had high expectations because of previous experiences at Embassy Suites in Texas and Pennsylvania. Very disappointed in overall appearance of lobby area of hotel; especially breakfast area. Thought I was in a roadside chain of some sort. Tables took too long to get bused, ran out of ingredients for omelets, some food lukewarm. Absolutely not typical of my previous experiences with Embassy Suites. Stayed here rather than Hilton Back Bay because of convenience to airport. HUGE Mistake. Overpriced parking; business center printers were totally out of order as was kiosk in front desk area designed to print out boarding passes. Don't know what the problems were because hotel didn't seem that crowded. Hot tub was filthy and subsequently had a sign stating it was closed for maintenance. Perhaps due to complaints. Shouldn't be necessary for patrons to complain before maintenance is done. Overall it was a visit to a highly-overrated, highly over-priced hotel that was a disappointing experience for myself, my adult daughters and two teen grandchildren on their first visit to Boston. On the positive side, the front desk was most pleasant and accomodating. However, for the price there were lots of other choices which I would definitely choose next time. Shame, shame!

Reviews.Title: “Just the ticket for us”
Reviews.Author: sheltercove
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a long weekdend in Boston. June 29th- July 2nd. I did not want to pay center city prices. Since we are avid users of the T, we wanted to be close to a T stop. The made to order included breakfast and the nightly manager's reception was a definite plus. We are Hilton honors members and usuallly gravitate to Embassy Suites. As pointed out by other reviewers there are some differences at this Embassy Suites. You do not have the large atrium with all of the rooms coming off of it. Your room opens onto a hall instead. This eliminates one of my pet peeves found in most Embassy Suites. That is the 3 AM door slam which tends to reverberate throughout the cavernous atrium. If you are sleeping on the pullout, this is something you can't miss. The rooms are a little smaller, but not to the extent that it causes a problem. They have at least 4 shuttle busses. (I counted) They are very close to the airport. Our view overlooked the Dollar rent a car lot with the airport in the backround. If you have kids who love planes, you can look out the windows and watch the planes take off. You also overlook the new astroturffed ball fields. Bring your soccer ball and enjoy. The new T station is a very short walk from the hotel. You simply come out the main entrance, cross the street, walk around the fields to the left, and run right into the T station. If you are in Boston for a few days and plan to use the T for your travels, get the 7 day link pass for only 12 dollars. The T is an experience in itself. Lots of people watching and always a station convenient to your destination. Boston is a walking city, and the T helps you to do that. The hotel has a business center with computers for your use. There is a small gym with a couple of treadmills and a few other machines. The pool was mainly frequented by children nonstop. There was supposed to be adult supervision, but I rarely saw any. So if you are an adult looking for a little relaxation in the hot tub, this is not the place for it. I don't fault the hotel for this situation though. Just a product of the me generation. To sum it up, I would use this hotel again in a heartbeat when visiting Boston. P.S. There is a kiosk located by the front desk for you to print out your boarding passes. (very convenient indeed)

Reviews.Title: “Worst Embassy Suites in the US”
Reviews.Author: phxdaddio
Reviews.Content: I've been a Hilton Diamond member for 7 years and spend 4 days a week in Hilton properties for business. I use the points each year for hotel stays on vacation with the family and typically stay at Embassy Suites....this is by far the worst Hilton location I have ever stayed at; missed wake up calls, no alarm clocks in the room, beds not made, 1 towel in room, no soap, no utensils at breakfast buffet, 45 minutes to get valet service and a staff that didn't care one way or the other about any of the above. The location wasn't the best, but the subway station was only a 5 minute walk...that is about the only positive thing I can say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for all, great deal and location!!”
Reviews.Author: MomEmily
Reviews.Content: Went to a business conference at the BCEC (Boston Convention center) in June 2007. I was with my daughter who is 11. I got a GREAT rate using my AAA membership via the Embassy Suites website. About 40 to 50% less than the hotels attached to the center (Seaport and the Westin). This hotel is convenient to the airport and to all public transportation which is a breeze to use once you get used to it. We drove in with a rent a car - then I checked in with my bags and returned the car and the hotel shuttle picked me up. The airport is literally a stones throw from the airport. But I never was bothered by airplane noise. We had a FABULOUS room. The only room left was a handicapped accessible - no problem as the only change was grab bars and a higher table. Despite the discounted rate, we had a room with a beautiful view of the Boston skyline. You can walk to the T line (subway) through a nice park area or you can take the shuttle to the bus to the T line. After the conference we went all over boston using our subway cards and it was a snap. I am a west coaster so we dont usually do public transportation but it was easy and quick. The hotel as with all embassy suites has a cooked breakfast. It was really helpful and we always took just a couple things for later snack like a piece of fruit or yoghurt which you can put in your inroom refrigerator. The ONLY drawback is you are not close to ANY type of food service so eat while you are out and again you can stock up on a couple snack items from breakfast for later. Also suggest that you NOT take a car as it is not setup for parking. In addition, if you have kids the pool is not huge and is indoor and not heated. However my daughter enjoyed watching the rain while in the pool! But if you check very few hotels in Boston that are family friendly have pools. I would definately return to this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good airport hotel, don't expect nice Embassy touches”
Reviews.Author: DrHickenlocher
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business conference and the hotel was selected by the conference organizers. Upon arriving at Boston Logan Airport, I called the hotel for their airport-hotel shuttle, which arrived about 5 minutes later at the Courteousy Bus zone outside baggage claim. It's a short drive to the hotel (for reference, it's a little more convoluted drive returning back, so allow for 10 minutes to get back to the airport). Unlike most Embassies I've visited, the atrium doesn't extend all the way up to the top floors. The building is much more like a standard hotel with enclosed hallways and rooms on both sides of the hallway, rather than being open to the atrium. There's also no pond or anything in the atrium, just the restaurant. Service was courteous and efficient. I never had to wait long at the check-in desk and room service only took 30 minutes. However, restaurant and room service prices were pretty high. Most entrees on the menu were $30, plus 18% automatic gratuity for room service, PLUG $3 delivery charge. I did like the room layout and everything was very comfortable. Instead of the "rectangular" standard Embassy layout where you enter into the living room and then the bedroom is further back by the window, with the bathroom sandwiched in the middle, this had more of a "square" layout. The living room extended all the way to the back wall and window, the bedroom was to the right with its own window, and the bathroom was in the hallway corner with doors opening to both living and bedrooms. Bed was comfortable with 5 pillows and a soft down duvet (no ratty comforters!). Desk chairs were plushy, standard couch and TVs. All in all, would have gotten a 4-rating if the restaurant weren't so pricy.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: JeanninePC99
Reviews.Content: After a week in my old home town for business, I decided to stay at Logan the night before my 6 AM flight home. I returned my rental car and the car company's shuttle dropped me right off at the hotel (as opposed to leaving at the terminal to call the hotel's shuttle). Check in was quick and easy...there was a flight crew checking in as well and the three people behind the desk took care of us all within a few minutes. The room was a big surprise. I used to stay in Embassy Suites hotels for work and this one is nothing like the ones I remember. Inside, it's completely new. The rooms are large and bright with good kitchettes and HUGE bathrooms. The bathroom had a door into the living room and a door into the bedroom...nice touch. There was enough furniture to allow a few people to lounge around and watchin TV, but not enough to crowd the room at all. The walls were solid and I never heard a a neighbor or a plane (any business traveler who has stayed at an airport hotel knows how important this is!). I was only in this hotel for about seven hours, but they were good ones. When I checked out at 4 AM, the guy working the front desk was cheerful and upbeat. There was a security guard there as well and the shuttle driver was equally chipper. It was a quick stay, but one I'd say tops those I've had at Embassy Suites hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Rooms, Service a bit slow”
Reviews.Author: Mikeymike15
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Embassy Suites at Logan Airport in Boston on a Thursday night in May of 2007. I was on a business trip with 5 other colleagues. This hotel was reccomended to me but fellow colleagues at our company. ROOM: In general, the rooms were fantastic. My room was essentially three rooms (living room, bathroom, and a bedroom). The bed was large (king) and extremely comfy. The linens were drawn and they had big fluffy pillows. The decor was modern and fresh. The bathoom was crisp and well maintained (i.e. no water marks on the ceiline, no mildew or gunk on the tiles, no cracked floor tiles). The living room was small but functional with a desk, a TV and small loveseat type couch. LOCATION: The hotel is situated just outside of the airport immediately behind several off-site rental car componies. My view overlooked the maintenance area of the airport. The shuttle picked us up from the Terminal and took us directly to the hotel (about a 5 minute jaunt after picking up customers at other terminals) AMENITIES: The one-down side was there was no Free Wi-Fi nor pay Wi-Fi in the room. My connection worked fine in the lobby, but I didn't want to spend all my time in the lobby. That said, I rcvd a complimentary USA Today in the moring along with a Free Breakfast and cookie a check-in. SERVICE: Check-In service was expeditious and polite however the restaurant service was extremely slow. The night we checked in, the 6 of us went down for dinner around 8:15PM. There were maybe 5 other tables already seated (amongst a capacity of 25 tables and a bar). The waitress was courteous but took well over 10 minutes before she even took our drink order. The food order took about 30 minutes to get to us and was not cooked properly. Most everyone's food appeared to be over-cooked and dry. The food in general tasted about average however my pork tenderloin was ~$25. This only came with veggies and mash. I would reccommend drinking in at the bar but finding another restaurant outside of the hotel for better service and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of bait and switch. Horrible restaurant”
Reviews.Author: CousinsIslandgirl
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation and received a special rate for the Park and Fly Package. We received a confirmation letter quoting our rate for the Park and Fly package. We arrived to the hotel and had dinner at the restaurant (horrible food â€“ read below for more on that). We were exhausted and went to bed early. At 9:30pm we received a call from the parking valet telling us that we didnâ€™t have a Park and Fly rate and that weâ€™d have to pay $30 per day for parking while we were away on our 10-day trip. Knowing we were leaving on an early morning flight, I knew I had to straighten the problem out immediately. I got up, went to the front desk and talked to the manager on duty. After he consulted the Operations Manager, I was told that I was given a discounted rate, so they would not discount the parking. I showed him my confirmation letter with the Park & Fly rate on it, but he said the rate quoted was wrong, and actually had to gall to tell me that I should have realized that when I got the rate. He wanted to either charge me $300 for parking or an additional $270 for the Park & Fly going rate. I explained had I known that our rate was wrong, weâ€™d have gone to a different hotel with an AFFORDABLE Park & Fly rate. No further discussion would change his mind. We spent the next hour researching off-site parking, finally got to bed at midnight, and worried all night about how weâ€™d find affordable parking and still make our plane. The next morning, we got up an hour earlier thinking weâ€™d have to move the car and find alternate parking. My husband went down to the car to stow clothes we didnâ€™t need, and ended up telling the parking attendant our story. The parking attendant said â€œno, our policy for overnight guests is $10 a day for parking.â€� He went to the front desk (new personnel now) and they immediately set up a $10/day parking program for us. Why couldnâ€™t we have been spared all the anxiety of the night before? The restaurant is in the center of the hotel â€“ itâ€™s basically the lobby. The bartender was surly and curt. A beer and a glass of wine was over $14.00 with a small tip. We were told there was a 20-minute wait for a table, yet there were many empty tables in the restaurant. We sat at the bar for dinner, which meant the surly bartender was our waiter. He immediately told us it would take our dinner 30-45 minutes to arrive. When the food arrived in about 35 minutes, it was horrible. We ordered mussels that were mushy and actually filled with mud â€“ probably dredged from the bottom of Boston Harbor. We sent them back and the dining room manager said â€œwell, weâ€™ve been serving them all night and theyâ€™ve been fine,â€� like it was our fault they were so disgusting. Our kidsâ€™ chicken fingers were overcooked and so salty they couldnâ€™t eat them. My husband and I split a greasy Rueben and a Caesar salad drenched in dressing. On a better note, the rooms are fine and the breakfast is very good â€“ with hot entrees and â€œmake your ownâ€� omelettes. However, this was hardly worth the angst they put us through on the rates and parking.

Reviews.Title: “Check your credit card statement after staying here!”
Reviews.Author: webcentrik
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Embassy Suites on March 10th, 2007 and booked through priceline. Had a fairly good experience at the hotel but this past weekend looked over my credit card statement and had a erroneous $155 dollar charge from the embassy suites on March 30th. Called the accounting dept and promptly had it removed! Someone at the hotel is a ripping people off. fortunately for me i used a new card with very few transactions or this charge would have been overlooked more than likely! buyer beaware!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: MrktMgr
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel because I was in town for a day visiting my Dad and flying back home to Europe the following day. Brought Dad in to Boston so that we could take in the sights. We used the Embassy Suites as our base-camp. Funny, I didn't see mention of the fact that the T station (subway) is within walking distance of the hotel. This was a great added bonus. Even though the hotel shuttle bus will take you over there, we opted for the walk at night and felt safe all the way there and back. It's only about 15 minutes walk. Might not be the right choice to walk if you are on your own. The hotel is good. Our room was in good condition and the breakfast was excellent - love those omelettes. I used the exercise room, but was a bit dissapointed that they didn't have an elliptical trainer. I made do with the treadmill. The exercise room was small but very clean. Would have liked a shower room so that I didn't have to scare the guests in the elevator on my way back up to my room. As stated in other reviews - there is nothing around this hotel. If you want to go out, you'll have to get on the "T" and go just a couple of stops find the action. Shuttle to the airport terminals was good and fast - same for the pickup. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: EfficientTraveler
Reviews.Content: Had early AM flight next day. Located near airport property; very clean. Bar service very slow. No free alcohol for Managers reception (state law). Shuttle service was good. Rooms clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: weege123
Reviews.Content: First time staying on the airport, we usually stay @ The Wyndham Financial District( now a Hilton). Since Hilton has taken over, the average weekend rate has increased,,,a lot. After reading all the reviews about how clean The Embassy Suites was, we tried it, and were not disappointed. Tip # 1) Sign up as a Hilton Honors member. It's free, and gives you a room upgrade, and late check-out. Tip #2)Park @ Wonderland, the last stop on The Blueline for $3 a day. This will avoid the hotels $30 parking fee. Tip #3) Buy a 24hr Charlie card to ride the "T". You can now ride any public transportation in Boston, as often as you like. When we arrived @ The airport T station, called the hotel, and the free shuttle picked us up within 10min. We used this shuttle from the hotel at least 4 times, and never had to wait more than 10min. Only once did we swing through the airport to pick up some other guests. The check in was less than 2min. and the room was spotless. We had a huge corner room on the 3rd. floor. No matter what room you get, there are no views. From every room in the hotel, you will only see the rental car parking lots. Pool & hot tub are very small. 2 adults fill the hot tub, put a family in the pool, and no one else wants to go in. Managers reception was soda, Chex Mix, cheese & crackers. Massachusetts law forbids liquor being served. Free breakfast in the morning was an added bonus. Plenty of hot & cold items. Everyone at this hotel was very friendly & helpful.
