If you want a clean, friendly, reasonably priced hotel. Stay here. If you want beautiful city views, and walking distance to everything, this is not your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Virgin. Watch out for reception staff.”
Reviews.Author: Andrew-Beaumont
Reviews.Content: We didnt want to stay here. We arrived at Logan to fly back to London in the middle of the August Security Scare. As a result, several flights were cancelled including our Virgin flight to Heathrow. Whilst it was not Virgin's fault, they realised we had 3 small children and put us up in the Embassy for 2 nights. By the time all of this was sorted, we were very tired and just wanted to get to the hotel. We asked for a crib for our baby. When we got to the hotel, we were met by a very grumpy receptionist who treated as though we shouldnt be staying there for free. Despite the fact that Virgin had promised us a crib, he advised the hotel didnt have any and we should go back to the airport and speak to Virgin to sort it out. Got to the room and spoke to Duty Manager, John, who was fantastic. He drove around all the local hotels to find us a crib and brought it to the room. I am a gold HHonours member and this is the kind of service I expect. Turning to hotel, it is above average airport hotel. Excellent breakfast although big queues, good pool, free internet (a godsend as we needed to know about flights home), great rooms. Easy to get back into Boston as well from the 'T'. Nothing in local area though. If you need a hotel at Logan you could do a lot worse, just pray you get a smile at reception.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: pickupapenguin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a seven week coast to coast trip in September. Picked because of good reviews on trip advisor. Hotel is right near the hire car depots which is handy. Although it is on airport property it's a little way from the terminal so make sure you take the phone number and call them for the free airport shuttle when you arrive. Also, if you want to get a cab from the hotel, forget using the valet or calling a cab, you'll be waiting forever. Turn right out of the entrance and walk 20 yards to the street corner and hail one, they pass by every few minutes. Hotel is spacious, rooms nice. We were on the top floor and had a stunning view of the downtown skyline. Lobby is good, free breakfast is fair. Staff prompt and friendly. Would recommend staying in for arriving or departing, but not for anything longer as you'll be paying the airport toll a lot and negotiating the complicated airport road system into town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emma1975
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston for a trade show in October and the rates were very high. There were four of us travelling so we had to find a room that would accommodate all of us. Embassy Suites had some good rates and would allow us all to share 1 room. The rooms were very comfortable and very clean. Our room had a large boardroom table, which was useful to prepare for the show each night. There were 2 queen sized beds in one room and a sofa bed in the living area. As we were 2 couples, one had the room, one had the living area - it worked well. The bathroom was a 2 way bathroom which gave us some privacy. The hotel rate included shuttle service to and from the airport as well as a free cooked to order (plus continental) breakfast each morning. The variety of what was available for breakfast was great, although inconsistent. Don't expect to have the same variety every day. There is also manager's drinks each night, we only took part in that on one night, a nice touch. The staff, apart from the front desk staff, were all very pleasant. Often wearing several hats depending on what was required each day. As it was so close to the airport the wait for a taxi was very minimal. The restaurant/bar staff were also helpful, on our first night one of them sat down with us and provided us with some good Boston hints for our next days exploring! That was great! I would recommend anyone to stay at this hotel, especially if you are in town on business or a convention and need something that is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient airport hotel, great rooms, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: jonben
Reviews.Content: We had a horrendous journey, getting to the hotel at close to 7pm because of all of the traffic disruption in Boston. Check in was fine and the hotel is very well placed for car rental returns (Avis is the closest) and the shuttle picked me up from Alamo. Room was really comfortable, shame we were only there until 6.30 am the next morning for our flight out to the UK. Comfy doubles in one room and a sitting area with a sofa bed. Kitchenette (no cutlery though) and walk through bathroom. If downtown is accessible, then I guess this is an option for a Boston city stay, but it struck me that this is reallly meant to be an airport hotel. There's not much else in the immediate vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “I've been at better embassy's”
Reviews.Author: SPARKY0210
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here on Oct 22nd for 5 nights. The atrium area isn't as nice as other embassy suites that I have stayed at. The rooms dont open into the atrium, it is a standard hallway. The week that I was there, all that they had for the afternoon reception was chips, pretzels, celery, carrots and some cheese slices (about enough for 15 people). Certainly not enough for a meal. I had thought they would have a lot of appetizers seeing that Mass. wont allow happy hours. I had expected chicken wings, meatballs etc. When we arrived at the hotel we thought we would get a drink at the bar, it doesn't open until 5, it didn't look like you could order a sandwich either until 5:30. There is nothing within walking distance. We ordered 3 drinks later, a beer, a glass of wine and a rum and coke, the bartender didnt know if $20 would cover it, it came to $17, plus tip. Didn't stay there long. The breakfast is just so, so. probably the worse french toast i've ever had and the omelets werent much better. The living room area was adequate but not large. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were clean. It is a 15 minute walk to the subway and boston is usually very windy and can be pretty cold. You couldn't see many planes flying.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms only at this Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: Chase71
Reviews.Content: If you are expecting floors rising above a decorated the 1st floor dining area with flowing water streams and glass elevators its not. The rooms are in a separate side of the building connected via a hallway. The dining area/bar is really nothing more than an open floor with partitions and tables scattered around. The eating and bar drinks are airport priced and the food is average. To make it worse nearby off property dining options do not exist unless you want to walk 5 minutes to the subway and ride it to another part of town. The morning breakfast is pretty good with the typical cooked to order omelets. The rooms are spacious, with two TVs and a larger bathroom. Overall this Embassy Suites was a disappointment and not keeping with the traditional style Embassy Suites. With only 1 dining option it might be great short terms like airline staff but not for a business traveler staying more than 2 days.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel! Very clean and friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Paula7928
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites at Boston Logan for 3 nights Sept. 16 - 19, 2006 following a trip to Cape Cod. We were flying out of Logan and wanted to see Boston but did not want to pay the $300+ hotel rates to stay downtown. I booked the AARP rate for $151 on the Hilton website. I am very picky about hotels and our room was immaculate and is the cleanest hotel room I have ever stayed in. The room was nicely decorated and we had plenty of room. I don't know how old this property is but it appears brand new. The staff was very friendly and helpful. This hotel is located on a street with alot of car rental companies. We had rented from Alamo and turned the car in immediately upon arriving at the Embassy Suites. The hotel shuttle would have picked me up but I walked since it was a nice day. It took about 7 or 8 minutes to walk to the hotel We mostly took taxis to go downtown since we had our 4 year old and my parents who are older with us. Taxis cost anywhere between $22 and $25 to go to Faneuill Hall, Public Garden, or the Aquarium. I think that some drivers must have taken us the long way around. We paid a variety of rates to go and from the same places. For example one night we paid $27 to go to Faneuill Hall, coming back it was only $10. We had a mini-van going so that was an extra 5 and also going downtown you pay the fee for the Ted Williams tunnel (about $5 I think). So even after you subtract the mini-van and tunnel charges there is still a big difference in what we paid. I did take the T downtown by myself a few times and it was very easy. The hotel shuttle will take drop you off and pick you up at the Airport T station. I did walk the first time I went since it was in the afternoon. I do not recommend walking the first time you go as there is alot of construction in the area and it is difficult to find. I had to stop and ask people where it was a couple of times and ended up walking past where I should have. We enjoyed the free cooked to order breakfast every morning although we did have to wait in line for about 10 minutes every day to have the chef prepare our food. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kareberry
Reviews.Content: Getting there wasn't quite as simple as it might appear, which had a lot more to do with the Big Dig and less to do with the hotel itself! Everything from check-in to check-out was great! We were checked-in about 30 seconds after arrival. Our suite was a wonderful size for the 4 of us, and we appreciated the bathroom with entry from both the bedroom and the living area. My pet peeve is cleanliness, and the room was spotless. The complimentary evening Manager's Reception had really great snacks; seriously you could make an entire meal out of it if you wanted to. The breakfast was also delicious and filling. These things are important when traveling with teenagers! We had an early flight out and the shuttle was ready and waiting for us, and within about 3 minutes we were checking our bags in at the airport. We would definitely stay here again if we had another early flight out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: felicityt
Reviews.Content: This is a great find. It is very convenient to the airport (about a 5/10 minute shuttle ride depending on how many travellers are arriving or departing) and the shuttles run every 10/15 minutes. There are complimentary snacks in the lounge each night between 5 and 7 (more thana snack really, you could make a meal out of these) as well as a restaurant serving pretty OK food. Complimentary breakfast starts at 5.30am. I wish we had got up earlier to eat more of it, as it was very good (fresh waffles, food cooked to order etc). The hotel also has a small pool and hot tub and a gym area. Room was clean and comfortable and a decent size with a proper suite (i.e. a door between living and sleeping areas so that we could stay up after the kids went to bed). We will definitely be travelling back through Boston in future to have our stay here rather than in a different city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Night's Sleep”
Reviews.Author: brucegary
Reviews.Content: Except for a long 45 minute wait for the airport shuttle and a long drive to the hotel while the shuttle drove around and around the ariport, this hotel was a great one night stay for weary travelers. The bed was as comfortable as I could wish for. The usual efficient breakfast was up to all expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay...”
Reviews.Author: modestonut
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in mid June with husband and our 3 girls. The suite was wonderful! Our flight got in later than planned and we didn't get to the hotel until 9:30-10pm. The check-in was very quick and we ordered room service which was also very quick, reasonable and delicious. They were very accomodating for our youngest who had a quesy stomach...plenty of dry toast and crackers! I was a little worried about noise being so close to the airport, but this was one of the quietest rooms I have ever been in. The breakfast were great with the kids, a little crowded at times, but definitly a plus. The evening snacks were tasty - - nachos, veggies, crackers, dips. They also had a kids movie in a room just off the eating area with popcorn and another area had a computer with free internet access (which our teenager loved for catching up on her emails). The manager was very visible and friendly. The shuttle was slow picking us up from the airport, but the next 2 days the shuttle was perfect for us. We did walk from the T one time, which was just fine too.

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Needed”
Reviews.Author: ocdinaz
Reviews.Content: We flew into Boston Logan Airport on a Friday night with no reservation, called the Embassy Suites and were picked up within minutes. The rate was $139 for a King Suite which included a separate living area and pull out sofa. The hotel was clean and quiet. I never heard a plane. It was located in the midst of rental car lots, but that was fine... we wanted to rent one for a day. The buffet breakfast was included each morning with the option to special order from the chef. So many choices! From 5:30-7:30 p.m. daily there were snacks and drinks... also included. Veggies, chips and salsa, cheese and crackers, brownie bites. The Airport T Station was a little farther than expected... a good 7 minute walk... but the weather was perfect during our stay so it was fine. There's also a computer room off the lobby with free internet access and printers. Just beware... there's no place to eat around here except the lobby restaurant. We tried it Friday night and it was good... about $8.85 for a heaping burger and fries. Next time we'll stay at least one or two nights in downtown Boston. All the hotels we saw downtown were close to T stations so we could have gotten right back to the airport, but this hotel was definitely a good find for a first visit and we would stay again. Note: The hotel front desk could have been a little nicer. Everyone else was wonderful! They whisked us away to the airport by ourselves when we were ready.

Reviews.Title: “Service is sub-par”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I work with a company planning conferences and this is by far one of the worst Hilton Properties I've dealt with for an event. While this might be a great hotel for a family vacation... it is surely not the "attendee-pleasing" venue I was assured it would be. My guests complained of un-helpful hotel staff and extremely slow airport shuttles to the hotel. On top of that... I was told that I could leave packages at the front desk and that they had daily FedEx pickup. The packages were still at the hotel almost a week later. The room service was good and the free business center is nice, but overall not a great venue for a conference.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back as soon as we can !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Two adults, three teenagers - frequently having trouble finding suitable accomodation...not anymore. We struck gold when we found the Embassy Suites. Not only would we return but so would the young ones - praise indeed ! A warm and friendly atmosphere where nothing was too much trouble. The suites were modern and bright with all mod cons. Manager's reception provided free soft drinks and snacks to keep everyone satisfied. Apparently they cannot provide complimentary alcoholic beverages because of state law. The manager was exceptionally friendly and seemed genuinely interested in our comfort and visit. Breakfast was again excellent - even the chef was amazing - offering many varied choices of cooked breakfast - only problem here was the ever expanding waistline !

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointed with this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not up to Embassy standards. Dirty and run down furnishings. Linnen smelled. Breakfast was terrible (cold and undercooked). Waffle maker malfunctioning. I was so uncomfortable that I checked out early and moved. Stay somewhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't have chosen a better hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our daughter is currently studying in Massachusetts and we decided to meet up with her in Boston during her spring break as she had to leave her residence halls. After much research we booked the Embassy Suites and couldn't have been more pleased at our choice. We used the courtesy telephones at the airport and, within minutes of arriving at the airport from England, were on the bus to the hotel. The room was superb, immaculately clean (and kept that way throughout our 7 day stay). Having the separate living room with desk, comfy chair and sofa was ideal as, although we were all treating it as a holiday, our daughter also had study/work to do. To this end she had her laptop with her and the free internet access was a boon. Security-wise, reception were very accommodating and provided a safety deposit box large enough to take the laptop as well as other valables when we were out and about being tourists! The modern, and spotless, bathroom had constant hot water and towels were kept in plentiful supply. We enjoyed the breakfasts with omelettes/eggs cooked to order with a smile by Reynald. The potatoes and ready prepared eggs (scrambled) were not as hot as they could have been but there was plenty of juice, fruit, bagels, muffins, cereals, coffee etc. The Manager's reception was also handy for a snack when we were around. We didn't use the pool, although a young family seemed to be enjoying themselves in it one evening. We timed the walk to the T and it took us 5 minutes. As mentioned in other reviews you have to cross a building site but there is a designated tarmaced path. The 3 of us walked back late at night and felt fine, however, at that hour, if I had been on my own, I would have definitely called for the courtesy bus.
